She star him for the briefest of instants before he rushes off to aid of his fellow homeless... She can't believe what she's seeing.  The KID wades smack the midst of the remaining HARDHATS, and kicks ass -- spinning, pirouetting, kicking, clawing in a furious disp of pure athleticism.  It seems like he's everywhere at on There's only one other guy in Gotham City who can handle himself like this... Rallying behind him, the MARCHERS and HOMELESS PEOPLE sna bats and tire irons from the fallen HARDHATS -- and the t turns.  The invasion is being repelled.  Faced with renew resistance, the few HARDHATS still left standing TURN TAI race off to their VAN. Triumph in shantytown.  The MARCHERS and HOMELESS cluster together to lick their wounds -- and the KID, satisfied t everything is under control, turns and sprints off toward trees. But one prostrate HARDHAT is only playing dead.  As the K runs past, the HARDHAT extends a TIRE IRON into his path TRIPPING HIM, sending him sprawling in the snow.  The KID throws up his hands as the HARDHAT prepares to smash down him... CLANG.  The HARDHAT drops his tire iron and topples over, BOARDLIKE.  The KID looks up and sees VICKI standing ther with a baseball bat. He gives her a quick nod of acknowledgement as he gets to feet -- thanks for returning the favor.  He's about to li out again when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAIT!  Don't be afraid.  I wanted to thank you.  I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks. VICKI's mildly taken aback, but she reaches for her purse the same.  She's barely gotten her wallet open when the K snatches the bill out of her hands.  They stare at each o for a long moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick. -- and then he's bounding off like a shot.  VAULTING up i tree and vanishing amid the snowy branches.  VICKI starts follow, but there's no way she can keep up.  Instead she into her CAMERA BAG...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH TELEPHOTO LENS
dialogues.text: Using the long lens, she tracks the KID's progress throug treetops.  She can't actually see him, but occasional chu of SNOW and ICE are falling to the ground as he jumps fro limb to limb... For a moment it seems like she's lost him.  As she sweeps lens back and forth, scanning the trees, she catches sigh an EQUESTRIAN STATUE in the distance.  She ups the magnification so she can see the plaque on the pedestal. stone figure on the horse is Union war hero GEN. OLIVER W -- BRUCE's great-grandfather. As luck would have it, the KID drops to earth not ten fee from the statue -- VICKI's got him in her sights again. looks around cautiously to make sure no one's following, races toward a STONE BRIDGE which arches between two smal hillocks, over a frozen creek. There's a DRAINAGE TUNNEL, four or five feet in diameter, mounted in the bridge abutment, the KID pries off a wire and clambers inside, then pulls the grate back into place behind him.  Home sweet home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she lowers the lens.  Her face is full of conflicting emotions.  She'd love to corner this boy vigilante and fi out what his story is.  But on the other hand -- even the homeless are entitled to their privacy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CANARY sings in its cage as a BLACK CAT watches transfi from a nearby chair.  The cat arches its back -- waits -- SPRINGS AT THE CAGE, BATTING at it in midair.  The canary SHRIEKS; the cat YOWLS; a WOMAN snatches it up off the fl cradles it in her arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Hecate.  You don't want that scrawny little bird -- It's SELINA, looking ripe and slinky in a sheer black ensemble.  At the desk behind her is the PENGUIN, in his customary cutaway and waist-coat, polishing his new RAVEN bares his teeth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to wring that creature's neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try it, I'll do the same to you. (as he grumbles; bemused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman.  He was dreamy. She strokes the cat, in a reverie.  The PENGUIN drops his polishing cloth, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreamy?!? Are you insane!? My God -- (sputtering wildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it was him?  What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stood on a roof and watched me. He didn't realize I'd seen him. I don't think he knew quite what to make of me. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was definitely interested. This sends the PENGUIN into a frantic round of pacing.  ( waddling.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This scheme of yours is backfiring.  We don't need him on our tails.  Do you know how much money is at stake here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money isn't everything. (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point if we can't enjoy ourselves? She chuckles to herself.  He stares at her in disbelief - SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big SIGN over Gotham Square tells us there are only 9 shopping days left until Christmas.  Down below, BRUCE is walking VICKI to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-on-one, and he took 'em all out...then vanished into a drainage pipe -- right next to the statue of General Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My illustrious great-grandfather.  Think it's the same kid we heard about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be.  He reminded me of you. BRUCE chuckles. They pass a NEWSSTAND just outside the Gl building, pausing to stare at the headlines -- which SCRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman Suspect in Slaying of Millionaire Developer Commissioner Gordon Refuses Comment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accompanying photo is a full-color spread of the BLOO RED BAT painted on SHAW's wall.  BRUCE scowls at VICKI:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You work for this rag? (snatching up a paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boss is calling for Gordon's resignation -- unless he brings Batman in for questioning... VICKI nudges BRUCE and points at a STOREFRONT across the street.

dialogues.speaker: SOUVENIR SHOP
dialogues.text: The owner is in the store window, hastily removing all of Batman merchandise and setting up new displays devoted to TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES and THE SIMPSONS.  A MOTHER her squirming TODDLER past the entrance -- the kid smells heavy markdowns on Bat-shit, but Mom clearly doesn't approve...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: looking on in dismay.  BRUCE crumples the paper in outrag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a good PR man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal -- you buyin' or borrowin'? With a sullen look, BRUCE tosses the paper back on the ra VICKI pulls him off toward the entrance of the Globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what happens when you go after the rich and powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it wasn't me, remember?  I am rich and powerful -- As he's talking, BRUCE glances back at the newsstand.  He an AD FLYER tacked up on one side -- "LOOKING FOR LOVE? it in the GOTHAM GLOBE PERSONALS." Looking for Love.  Eyes widening, he digs in his pocket f quarter and races back to the newsstand.  VICKI keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's almost...good.  In a weird way. I mean, Shaw, and Barrett -- if people like that were really scared, maybe they'd -- She suddenly realizes she's talking to herself.  She turn around and sees BRUCE back at the newsstand, hurriedly unfolding a copy of the Globe.  She marches back and tugs his sleeve. VICKI (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm late for work.  You can read that later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  I'm looking for a personal ad. Her face screws up in confusion as BRUCE frantically scan page. BRUCE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tall, Dark And Handsome -- You saw me on  the roof 12/16.  I was in black; you were too."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of bad joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. That cat woman, or whatever she is. (reading aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I jumped a bus into Gotham Park hoping you'd follow, but you were too shy..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she want -- a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying to contact me.  Says she's gonna leave me another ad... The two of them exchange a look of utter perplexity.  BRU mind is racing; he seems bizarrely aroused -- in a way th makes VICKI just a trifle nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI arrives at her desk and sets her portfolio down.  S spots a message in the "in" file.  She takes one look at and her eyes go wide with RAGE.  She storms out in a fury

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barging past a phalanx of SECRETARIES, VICKI bursts into inner office of HARRISON J. PROVOST, publisher of the Glo He's just opening his mail.  He heaves a weary sigh as VI BARKS at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door. (waiting for her to calm down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your story isn't news.  With Shaw dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the project's still going ahead!  If attacking homeless people in the park isn't news, I'd like to know what is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a psycho out there in a mask and cape -- killing off Gotham's most prominent citizens! That's news. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known Randall Shaw all my life.  His family is in mourning.  And it just so happens I don't believe in slandering the dead. VICKI FUMES.  She turns and stares PROVOST straight in th eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Provost -- how much money do you have tied up in the Park Tower project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki...I'm going to forget you made that remark.  For the sake of your job, I suggest you do the same. VICKI stalks of -- and PROVOST goes back to his mail.  He finds an envelope addressed in a shaky, psychotic scrawl, the word "CONFIDENTIAL" underlined three times in ink.  H tears it open -- -- and HIS FACE TURNS PALE as he stares down at the conte a small business-sized card, signed with a BAT-EMBLEM... THOSE WHO FEED ON THE SOUL OF GOTHAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER BARRETT and his ATTORNEY emerge onto the front ste the courthouse.  BARRETT is instantly mobbed by REPORTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Barrett!  Any comment on the arraignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true bail was set at two million dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back!  My client has nothing to say at this time! The ATTORNEY clears a path for BARRETT, who climbs into a waiting CAR, shielding his face.  REPORTERS cluster aroun it... As the car pulls out into traffic, we see a flock of PIGE taking wing from their perches on the statues outside the of Justice.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARRETT'S CAR
dialogues.text: PIGEONS fill the frame, swooping down toward the CAR, whi idling at a traffic light far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The liveried DRIVER drums his fingers as he waits for the light to change.  BARRETT's in the back, speaking into hi cellular phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time we called an emergency meeting of the Raven Society.  Get back to me... Looking troubled, he hangs up.  A fat white glob of PIGEO SHIT splatters across the windshield.  Seconds later -- another SPLAT. BARRETT (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just washed it, too. The DRIVER reaches for the wiper switch.  They hear a tin DINK as a SOLID PELLET bounces off the windshield. BARRETT and the DRIVER exchange a mystified look.  A smal blinking CAPSULE has just lodged in the wiper-blade assembly...

dialogues.speaker: ON BARRETT'S CAR
dialogues.text: Just as the light changes, the CAR EXPLODES into a millio fragments -- leaving a BLACKENED CRATER in the middle of intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A VIDEO MONITOR -- showing FIRE TRUCKS in the intersection we've just left, hosing down the wreckage of BARRETT's car.  BRUCE is watching intently when ALFRED ap behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fluegelheim called again, sir.  They want to know if you'll be attending the opening of the new Egyptian exhibit. BRUCE, still engrossed in his news broadcast, waves ALFRE off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancel. ANCHORWOMAN (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and, citing new evidence in the so- called string of "millionaire murders," Police Commissioner J.T. Gordon today swore out a warrant for the arrest of Batman. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go now live to Mike Sekowsky, spokesperson, Order of the Bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez!  Talk about gratitude -- !! At the sight of SEKOWSKY's face, BRUCE kills the sound in disgust.  ALFRED looks on helplessly as he paces the floo the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Alfred, it's official. I'm a wanted man. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "New evidence"...I've gotta find that woman.  Did you check the personals? As ALFRED shakes his head no, a BUZZER sounds.  They've g visitor.  BRUCE hits a switch on a monitor, and sees COMMISSIONER GORDON'S CAR sitting outside the wrought-iro gates of Wayne Manor. He throws a nervous look at ALFRED.  ALFRED speaks into a microphone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Gordon, Alfred.  I've got to see Bruce. A spooky development.  Does GORDON suspect?  After a mome hesitation, BRUCE nods to ALFRED -- let him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wayne will see you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curious BRUCE ushers GORDON into the library, gestures toward the liquor cabinet.  The Commissioner nods his hea He's fidgety, ill at ease -- he obviously doesn't want to here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to bother you.  Bruce -- I'll get right down to it.  You knew Shaw and Barrett --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw them occasionally.  We all sat on the board of the Fluegelheim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have any...dealings with them, or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I never liked the way they did business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, Bruce, you're all lumped together in the public mind -- the Five Families of Gotham, that sort of thing -- and, uh... (taking a card from his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison Provost got this in the mail. BRUCE examines the card, -- "THOSE WHO FEED," etc.  He st at GORDON in mock-concern, playing it close to the vest..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Batman is behind all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman or a damned good imitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  He's changed tactics, hasn't he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging; at a loss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw, with his high-rises -- Barrett, a druglord, major polluter -- they weren't exactly model citizens.  Who knows, it could be some crazy social-conscience kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he's going after...the root of the problem. GORDON shakes his head and gets up to go.  BRUCE hands hi card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if you get one of these. We'll put all our resources at your disposal. BRUCE nods thoughtfully as ALFRED appears to see the Commissioner out.  A moment later, the butler reappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changed my mind, Alfred.  I'll be dropping in on the Fluegelheim after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a party to celebrate the opening of the new Egyptian exhibit, and the Fluegelheim is hopping.  BOARD MEMBERS, MUSEUM PATRONS, and SOCIALITES mill about in dinner jacke and evening gowns, making small talk.  AN OPEN SARCOPHAGU been set up as a wet bar. On a raised concrete platform in the center of the hall, rimmed by a decorative moat, sits an ancient Egyptian SHR The TEMPLE OF BASTET has been moved to Gotham and reconstructed in the Fluegelheim --sandstone walls, fount statuary and all. Guarding the entrance is a stately bronze statue of the goddess BASTET -- who has the body of a woman and the hea a pointy-eared CAT.  She holds an aegis and a sistrum; fo tiny KITTENS romp at her feet.  BRUCE, who's just arrived taking an intense interest in the cat-goddess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had a weird sense of deja vu. He glances over by the sarcophagus and sees PROVOST, the publisher, huddle with ELIOT TIPTREE III, transit magnate the remaining member of Gotham's "Five Families." The tw them are engaged in some urgent conversation which he can quite make out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrison -- we really ought to warn Bruce. We owe him that much. BRUCE detaches himself from VICKI and strolls toward them PROVOST and TIPTREE force smiles and wave, affecting an a nonchalance. PROVOST (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's a space cadet. Let him look out for himself. (as BRUCE arrives; cheerfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Bruce!  What a delightful surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you two. Looks like the Five Families are suddenly down to three. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, if somebody dropped a bomb on this room right now -- TIPTREE chuckles nervously.  PROVOST is even less amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your idea of a joke, Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.  Commissioner Gordon seems to think we should all be hiring bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: TIPTREE PROVOST
dialogues.text: Oh, that's absurd. I already have. The two of them glower at each other. It's like an outta from The Newlywed Game. BRUCE shrugs it off and m vacuous face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, I can't imagine why Batman would be after us.  Can you? PROVOST and TIPTREE are about to go into another round of hemming-and-hawing when a NEW FACE joins the party.  It's SELINA KYLE -- stunning as ever in an extravagantly revea dress slit up to the armpits.  She's holding two glasses CHAMPAGNE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two look like you need a drink.  -- And is this who I think it is? She flashes BRUCE her most winning, seductive, heavy-arti SMILE.  He BLINKS, temporarily speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selina Kyle -- Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our absentee board member!  I've been wanting to meet you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selina's the new Curator of Antiquities. She brought the Temple over block by block --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two won't be terribly upset if I borrow Bruce for a moment, will you? Before he can protest, she's linked an arm around his and dragged him off.  A nearby FAT MAN spots SELINA, wiggles eyebrows and WAVES BRIGHTLY.  His tongue is practically hanging out -- he's just dying to write her a check.  SEL SIGHS WEARILY to BRUCE: SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major contributor.  -- I always seem to wind up in charge of fund-raising...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tax year's almost over, you know. I hope we can count on your usual generous donation. (indicating PROVOST and TIPTREE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's got to set an example for those two tightwads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're proccupied.  This string of murders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked them if they'd consider including us in their wills. (chuckling to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't seem a bit amused...

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: She's making small talk with a bunch of STUFFED SHIRTS an their overdressed WIVES.  She glances across the room at statue of Bastet, sees SELINA draped all over BRUCE.  A f crosses her face...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE AND SELINA
dialogues.text: She's still clinging to his arm as they stare up at the statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and this is my good friend Bastet, the Egyptian Cat Goddess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've already met.  -- This is quite an expedition you've put together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you think so.  I have to say, Bruce -- you're not at all what I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's not that.  Not at all.  It's just that I'd always heard you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coyly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...sort of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling; fascinated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Come on.  What? BRUCE's state of mounting infatuation is abruptly shatter when VICKI sidles up alongside him and -- territorially - takes his other arm.  The women exchange big, toothy, pla smiles; stranded in the middle, BRUCE realizes they're wa for him to introduce them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Selina Kyle -- my friend Vicki Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer.  I've seen your pictures in the Gazette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's right.  The tabloid one.  -- What an original dress! VICKI, still smiling, cocks an eyebrow at BRUCE.  He sens trouble coming and tries to head it off at the pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selina supervised the reconstruction of the temple.  Brought it back from Egypt... stone by stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. She must be awfully tired. (to SELINA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get to be in charge of a huge project like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was easy.  I slept with the Pharoah. She laughs at her own joke.  VICKI responds with a dry li chuckle of her own.  SELINA gives BRUCE a SHARP YANK on t sleeve. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, won't you, sweetheart?  We have some boring museum business to talk about. VICKI fumes.  BRUCE shrugs apologetically as SELINA drags off out of earshot. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.  Short leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull in the claws, okay?  She's really terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Bruce. Sometimes I get a little...aggressive, you know? (handing him a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I need to talk to you.  Come by sometime.  I'll give you the private tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Let me explain about Vicki --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shushing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  Anyone who's that protective must have a pretty good reason for it. She shoots him one last smile -- sly, conspiratorial, unmistakably juicy.  Then she's off in pursuit of another major funder.  BRUCE is thoughtfully turning the card ove his hands when VICKI rejoins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's "business"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, okay?  I like you better. He scans the room, trying to find PROVOST and TIPTREE.  N luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking for your fellow millionaires, they left some time back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof of the Gotham Globe.  A STARLING circles overhea a moment -- then DIVES down an exposed VENTILATION SHAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO ARMED BODYGUARDS are standing watch outside an office Brass letters on the door read "J. HARRISON PROVOST,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROVOST, agitated, working late.  He speaks, <i>sotto voc the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that.  I've had the office swept for bugs.  No one's listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE in his paneled study at home.  There's an open bo on the table and he's been hitting the sauce -- hard.  Hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so -- unfair. I mean...it was over a century ago. It's not like we're responsible. (hollow-eyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he know?  How could Batman know about the Raven Society??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows and who cares.  The point is, it's happened... He hears a CHIRP and looks up.  It seems to be coming fro HEATING VENT on the wall.  But then it stops, so he resum his conversation -- PROVOST (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clearing out of the country, and I'm taking the raven with me.  I suggest you do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the metal shaft on the other side of the grate is a ti BIRD -- the same one we saw flying down the air shaft.  N that we've got a close-up view, we can see the thin BATTE PACK wired to its underbelly...and the MINIATURE MICROPHO taped to its leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you how to reach me.  And don't repeat this to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN stands over his indoor penguin pool.  He's we rubber gloves, feeding LIVE FISH from an ice chest to his arctic birds.  The vents in the windows are open, and the climate in the room is downright icy as SELINA's wrapped fur, stroking her pet cat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just another rich idiot. (chuckling to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The odd thing is, he didn't seem a bit concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he is an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives in some big sprawling manor. I'll have to get inside, scope it out... see where he's got the raven stashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you plan to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think! A feline smile from SELINA.  The PENGUIN chuckles to hims lobs a FISH out over the pool.  A swooping GULL snatches out of the air before it hits the water.  FRICK arrives i doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mr. Provost, sir.  He's planning to embark on an unscheduled Christmas vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  That should save us a trip to the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge open room cluttered with all kinds of junk: archaeologist's tools, restoration equipment, etc., plus healthy assortment of curios and oddities from all over. is SELINA's private domain.  CAMERA TRACKS past a glass c full of ugly, withered, turdlike specimens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mummified cats.  Bastet's sacred animal. They were buried by the thousands at Bubastis.  -- Oh, careful! BRUCE FREEZES with his hand poised over a set of four ear JARS.  Each has a lid carved in the shape of a HEAD: ape, jackal, man, falcon. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canopic jars. In the process of mummification, the internal organs were buried separately. (pointing to each jar in turn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lungs -- stomach -- liver -- intestine -- BRUCE withdraws his hand with a bemused shudder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a gruesome line of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeps me interested.  And that's not easy to do... BRUCE's attention turns to a crumbling statuette of an od beast: a WINGED LION with the head of a FALCON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one I know.  It's a gryphon, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.  A mythical demon, half-bird, half-lion...sweeping down from the sky to deliver retribution and justice. BRUCE nods.  He can dig it.  He regards the gryphon for a moment and CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor guy.  Birds and cats -- you wouldn't think the two halves would cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only under certain circumstances. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really glad you came, Bruce.  I was afraid I'd given you the wrong impression. Or maybe it was the right impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it you wanted to talk to me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your collection.  I'd love to see it.  I mean, everyone says you've got a fabulous -- She breaks off in midstream and chuckles to herself.  She demurely with her equipment.  She looks up at BRUCE and switches tactics -- going for the direct approach.  BRUCE braces himself... SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mainly I just wanted an excuse to see you again.  Does she know you're here -- Vicki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be strange.  Having all that power, and money -- never really knowing if that's what people are attracted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you attracted to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a little bit nuts. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a little -- bored with your life.  Having everything you want.  No variety, no...danger.  And every once in a while you need to take a risk.  Shake it all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe by...coming here today. She leans back against a crate, moistens her lips.  She's letting him have it with both barrels. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one thing I can give you, Bruce -- danger -- a little something you can't get at home. BRUCE hesitates -- but the lure is irresistible.  He move forward slowly; SELINA's eyes close; their lips draw slow closer... ...and he SNEEZES IN HER FACE.  She backs off in shock as covers his face.  His eyes are watering and he's WHEEZING She rushes over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a cat in here? Right on cue, SELINA's black cat HECATE lets out a loud M -- and STRETCHES against BRUCE's pants leg.  He brushes t animal aside and it LEAPS into SELINA's arms.  BRUCE snif uncontrollably. BRUCE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it away! She drops the cat, which scampers off.  BRUCE rubs his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing.  You're allergic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cats...ever since I was a kid... (snorting and weeping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd better get some fresh air.  Maybe another time, okay... He heads for the door before SELINA can stop him.  He's g but she knows she's left a dent in his armor.  She smiles bemusement as HECATE jumps into her arms and PURRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE stumbles out the museum feeling mildly discombobula He marches down the front steps past a NEWSSTAND -- where stops to buy a copy of the afternoon GLOBE. He opens it to the PERSONAL ADS and finds what he's been waiting for: TALL, DARK, AND HANDSOME -- Christmas is coming. Why don't we trim the tree together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This puzzles him for a moment -- until he looks up the st In the distance, at the very center of Gotham Square, WOR are stringing lights around an enormous CHRISTMAS TREE, a fifty feet tall. The LIGHTING CEREMONY is an annual event in Gotham.  BRUC smiles slightly, tucks the paper under one arm and walks his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW falls on a huge CROWD gathered around the big tree. tree won't be lit for another twenty minutes or so, and s ONLOOKERS are singing CHRISTMAS CAROLS from printed lyric sheets. A BAND is playing on a makeshift ORCHESTRA PLATFORM erect front of the tree, leading the crowd in a spirited rendit of "God Rest Ye Merry, Gentlemen."  The Square is rocking good will toward men.  When they get to the part about sa us all from Satan's power --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the CAMERA TILTS UPWARD to BATMAN, watching the action his usual gargoyle's perch.  He's scanning the streets an rooftops, waiting tor the CATWOMAN to make her move -- whatever it is. He glances at the building directly across the square fro him.  On the roof is a neon sign reading Gotham City Glob ornate old-English letters -- and above that, a ROTATING SCULPTURE of the world turning.  His eyes rove downward a the facade of the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At street level, an ARMORED CAR has pulled up in front of Globe offices.  THREE SECURITY GUARDS with rifles climb o the ARMORED CAR, followed by a FOURTH -- who has an OBLON handcuffed to his wrist.  Of course, we can't see what's inside, but to those of us in the know the box looks just about the right size for a RAVEN STATUETTE. The GUARDS scan the street and enter the building without incident.  As they do, a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY VAN crosses t frame; mounted on its side is an ADVERTISING PLACARD whic reads: BATMAN: HERO OR MENACE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read All About It in the GOTHAM GLOBE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches with some curiosity.  An armored car: is this part of the CATWOMAN's scheme?  But no...the GUARDS are s inside the building, and the CAR is leaving.  He settles to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The innocuous-looking VAN rounds the corner of the Globe building.  FRICK is at the wheel, FRACK is riding shotgun the PENGUIN is between them, peering out eagerly through windshield. They turn into the Globe's BASEMENT GARAGE -- where dozen similar vans are parked at the LOADING BAYS.  Just part o fleet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quartet of SECURITY GUARDS arrive at PROVOST's office The publisher has already packed his suitcases for a spee getaway.  The LEAD GUARD -- the one cuffed to the RAVEN B sets his precious cargo on a desk and stands discreetly a arm's length while PROVOST unlocks it and checks its cont Satisfied, he slams it shut.  He reaches into his top dra for an ENVELOPE, which he hands to his PERSONAL SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this in an hour. Phone my wife and tell her where to meet me. (to the GUARDS; edgily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble on the way, I take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, Mr. Provost.  We came straight from the bank vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Copter should be just touching down. We'll have you safely out of here in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Here Comes Santa Claus" echoes up from the streets.  BAT watches as a COPTER descends toward the HELIPAD on the ro the Globe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROVOST and the LEAD GUARD with the raven box are at an elevator bank.  The other GUARDS head for a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll check the stairs.  See you on the roof. The LEAD GUARD starts to press the UP button, but PROVOST pulls a key from his pocket instead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- my private elevator.  It's safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shooting DOWN on the car as it rises.  The shaft above it filled with BIRDS -- starlings, crows, pigeons and the li swooping and gliding among the gears and cables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In BG, the helicopter on its pad, idling noisily, the rot still spinning.  In FG, the small dormer-like structure t houses the STAIRWAY.  The metal access door opens, and th first of the GUARDS steps warily out, rifle at the ready. smiles back at his pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  They don't pay us enough to tangle with Batm-- A black-gloved, CHROME-TALONED HAND snakes around the edg the dormer and RAKES ACROSS HIS THROAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWEAT beads up on PROVOST's lip as the GUARD hits the up button and the car begins to rise.  Suddenly, the LIGHTS OUT.  The car stops with a lurch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it??  What's happening?? Suddenly, there in the darkness, they hear a series of lo POPPING SOUNDS...which could be gunfire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: singing "Here Comes Santa Claus" at the top of their lung Happy faces beam.  No one hears anything unusual over the music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN straining to listen.  We get another faint series POPS -- barely audible over the CAROLING from below, and loud PUTT-PUTT-PUTT of the helicopter blades. He can't really be sure he's heard anything at all.  He s the roof of the Globe building, but he can't see what's happening beyond the big steel globe sculpture and the ne sign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CATWOMAN lets fly with another burst of automatic fir from the dead GUARD's rifle.  The helicopter is still idl but no one's left to fly it -- the rooftop is littered wi stiffs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PITCH BLACK.  Pre-verbal GROANS and MURMURINGS OF FEAR is from the darkness.  An EERIE RED LIGHT kicks on -- the emergency generators -- and we see PROVOST backed up in a corner of the car, twitching and jumping like a crazed spastic.  The GUARD, in a futile effort to placate him, p up at the LIGHT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  Mr. Provost.  See?  The generator's kicked in.  It's just an electrical problem. PROVOST is only marginally consoled.  They hear a strange TWITTERING NOISE in the shaft above them... PROVOST starts babbling again.  The GUARD slaps him acros face.  But the TWITTERING has him a bit concerned as well stares up at the ceiling of the car as he PUNCHES BUTTONS the panel; with another LURCH, the car begins to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  See?  It's moving.  We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going down.  We're going DOWN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BIRDS in the shaft have all ROOSTED on the TOP OF THE They're patiently riding it down as it descends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops again.  PROVOST is totally losing it.  The exasperated GUARD grabs him and SHAKES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mr. Provost -- I'm gonna have a look through the trap door.  But I need you to help me.  Okay?  You have to help. PROVOST nods and tries to get a grip on himself.  The GUA looks up at the trap door in the ceiling of the car.  He reach it... He uncuffs the BOX containing PROVOST'S RAVEN from his wr -- and STANDS on it.  Still short.  Unholstering his gun using it as a prod, he can almost reach the trap door.  H JUMPS UP and, poking with the gun, manages to dislodge th panel slightly. More TWITTERING.  PROVOST and the guard look up through t tiny crack in the ceiling and see nothing but darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably just some bird that's gotten in the shaft.  Now calm down.  You'll have to give me a boost. The GUARD climbs back atop the raven box.  PROVOST gives boost and he manages to catch hold of the lip of the trap door. GUARD (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, help me out...steady... PROVOST wraps both arms around the GUARD's wriggling LEGS tries to hoist him upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a vantage level with the roof of the car, we see the GUARD'S FINGERS, clinging to the lip of the trap door.  N his HEAD rises into view, pushing the panel aside as he p himself upward. He peers around.  His BROW wrinkles as he sees a bizarre -- PASSELS of SQUAWKING BIRDS, walking back and forth in of him, STRUTTING and PREENING mere inches from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom half of the GUARD dangles from the ceiling. PROVOST still has his arms wrapped around the GUARD's kne All at once, the GUARD begins to SCREAM -- his body JERKS his legs KICK WILDLY.  Still PROVOST struggles to hang on even as BLOOD spatters across the top of his bald dome... Finally, the GUARD's violent spasms are too much.  PROVOS trips over the raven box, stumbles backward and lands on ass in a corner of the car.  The GUARD tumbles in a heap the elevator floor, his face PECKED and CLAWED beyond recognition, his eyes gone altogether. PROVOST lets out a series of SHRIEKS.  He peers at the op trap door, sees the BIRDS staring curiously down at him, SHRIEKS AGAIN. The EMERGENCY TELEPHONE rings.  He stares at it.  It ring again.  Shielding his eyes and screwing up his courage, PROVOST crawls across the floor and reaches for the recei PENGUIN (V.O.; filter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteenth floor.  Linens, housewares, ladies' lingerie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-who is this??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSPAPER DELIVERY VANS are parked in neat rows -- all driverless.  FRICK is sitting with a boxful of electrical equipment next to a bank of ELEVATORS; all the cars have LOCKED OPEN here in the basement, except for ONE -- PROVO private elevator, the doors to which are still closed.  T PENGUIN stands beside it, speaking into a RED PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Provost?  If you want to get out of that car alive, I suggest you follow my instructions to the letter. As he talks, we see various NEWSPAPER EMPLOYEES sprawled the concrete nearby, DEAD.  A CORRUGATED METAL DOOR has b lowered over the LOADING BAY, separating the newspaper production staff from the VAN POOL.  They're trapped on t other side.  BANGING AWAY LOUDLY on the door... PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP IN THERE.
dialogues.text: (calmly; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see a cord hanging just behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROVOST looks over his shoulder and sees the aforemention CORD descending through the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- yes, I see it -- PENGUIN (V.O; filter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie the cord to the handle of your box. PROVOST lets the phone drop.  He grits his teeth, but has to obey.  As he's knotting the cord around the handle of box, a DINKY BIRD flutters down through the trap and send into a panic.  Practically weeping, he reaches for the ph PENGUIN (V.O.; filter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're done, I want you to give two sharp yanks on the cord. Cowering in terror, PROVOST reaches for the cord and yank twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you??  Why are you doing this??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, FRICK and FRACK are pulling on RED BERETS and BATMAN SWEATSHIRTS -- Order of the Bat gear.  FRICK climb into a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY VAN and starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Provost, I guess you could call me an irate reader.  And to be perfectly frank -- I'm doing this because I hate Garfield. Chuckling, the PENGUIN holds a SONIC DEVICE up to the mouthpiece of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHRILL WHINE emanates from the receiver.  All at once, elevator car is FULL OF BIRDS -- squawking wildly, flingi themselves against the wall, going insane in the tiny con space. PROVOST is screaming like a madman.  The birds are in his hair, his face -- everywhere.  He fights his way over to panel and begins punching buttons in a frenzy... All at once the car PLUNGES DOWNWARD.  It's as if the flo has DROPS AWAY beneath PROVOST's feet -- he's in FREE-FAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going down! He hangs up the phone and steps a discreet distance back the ELEVATOR DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAVEN BOX dangles from its cord in FG as the CAR rock uncontrollably downward.  A steady stream ot BIRDS are ma a quick exit from the trap door in the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CATWOMAN's on a landing near the stairwell, just belo dormer that leads to the roof.  She pries open a pair of ELEVATOR DOORS... ...and a FLOCK of BIRDS pours out of the empty shaft, mak for the open ACCESS DOOR a half-story above.  She reaches inside, finds the cord attached to the RAVEN BOX, and ree in. She rips off the lock and opens the box for a quick look her trophy.  It's there, all right -- another RAVEN just the first two.  An awful CRASH, from twenty-five stories RATTLES THE SHAFT... She makes a disgusted face, grabs the RAVEN, and bolts fo roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches in puzzlement as a VAST FLOCK OF BIRDS takes f from the Globe roof across the square.  Something weird i definitely going on.  He's about to abandon his post -- -- but down below, the CAROLERS have stopped CAROLING.  T big tree's about to be lit, and they're counting off the seconds:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten!  Nine!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ramshackle kiosk at street level.  The NEWS VENDOR has stepped out onto the sidewalk to watch the tree festiviti A GLOBE DELIVERY VAN, its side bearing the "BATMAN -- HER MENACE?" advertisement, cruises past and dumps a bundle o papers on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXCITEMENT is BUILDING as the seconds tick off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Three!  Two!  One! The CHRISTMAS LIGHTS come on, and the CROWD breaks into CHEERS.  The ORCHESTRA strikes up a sprightly version of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEWS VENDOR is applauding and singing along like ever else when a second newspaper van rumbles past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  No!  I aleady got a -- He spots TWO MASKED MEN in the doorway of the van -- wear RED BERETS and BAT-SHIRTS.  They shove a BODY out the doo The mutilated corpse of HARRISON PROVOST lands on the sid with a THUD -- right beside a bundle of NEWSPAPERS which

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEWS VENDOR chases after the VAN, but it's already ro a corner and is cruising along the periphery of Gotham Sq The CROWD is still singing merrily, unaware of its presen -- until the BACK DOORS fly open -- and a swarm of RABID, CHITTERING BATS screech out into the midst of the crowd!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAROLERS break into MASS HYSTERIA as HIDEOUS BATS swo down from above, CLAWING at their heads and shoulders. ORCHESTRA MEMBERS drop their instruments and stagger off BAND PLATFORM, falling into the branches of the giant Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS SHOPPERS are teeming in and out of nearby STORE They drop their SHOPPING BAGS and race about in utter CHA the bats attack.  WOMEN SCREAM.  CHILDREN SCREAM.  MEN SC TOO. A MAN staggers backward through a GLASS STOREFRONT and la on his butt in a WINDOW DISPLAY -- a big mechanical SANTA CLAUS on his North-Pole throne, chuckling merrily in a prerecorded voice: "HO HO HO."  The MAN STRUGGLES WILDLY the BATS converge on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORRIFIED SHOPPERS scatter through the aisles as the BATS in through the broken window.  WOMEN lined up for a FREE MAKEOVER squeal in panic as BATS arrive to rearrange thei hairdos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares down stunned at the PANDEMONIUM raging below. glances across the street...and sees the TINY SILHOUETTE WOMAN standing atop the cast-iron GLOBE SCULPTURE, LAUGHI the chaos, TAUNTING him.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: A few blocks away from Gotham Square.  SIRENS HOWL.  Ther steady stream of COP CARS speeding toward the site of the disturbance.  One vehicle is moving in the opposite direc against traffic -- a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN touches down on the roof and stares in horror at t CORPSES strewn across the helipad.  A dying GUARD raises shaky hand... BATMAN crouches beside him.  A GURGLE comes up from his t and a bubble of BLOOD swells on his lips.  All at once he hears a WOMAN'S VOICE from the shadows of the GLOBE SCULPTURE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people just can't take discipline. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Finish 'em off... His head jerks up.  He can't see anything.  A sudden WHOO noise, and now the voice is coming from the other side of roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might as well.  You're going to get blamed for it anyway. He stands.  He gets a quick glimpse of a FELINE SHADOW springing past a skylight; she's jumping all around the r clinging to exposed pipes and fixtures.  He reaches for a Batarang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, angel. You know you want to. (purring loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides -- I want to see how you do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? He's barely gotten it out when she SLAMS INTO HIM from be feet first, knocking him to the rooftop.  He tries to get but she comes at him with a couple of CARTWHEELING KICKS, knocking him back into a cornice.  He ducks right just as SHARP SPIKED HEEL strikes the exposed brick a mere three inches from his throat. He catches her leg, upends her -- but she somersaults awa lands on her feet.  Cats always do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, aren't we frisky tonight. He flings the BATARANG.  It CLANGS into the big NEON SIGN she SPRINGS up into the darkness, out of reach.  GLASS TU shatters and SPARKS FLY as she calls down from the shadow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should tell you -- I've got nine lives to play with -- and you've only got one... He turns -- she drops DIRECTLY ONTO HIM -- and locked in death grip, they STAGGER BACKWARDS across the roof, direc toward the HELICOPTER.  The huge ROTOR BLADES are still turning... BATMAN ducks instinctively and the CATWOMAN breaks free - FALLING BACKWARD onto the roof.  It's a strategic move: w he rushes at her, she BRACES HERSELF against the ground a KICKS UPWARD with startling force. This time the spiked heel connects -- LIFTING BATMAN off feet, KNOCKING HIM BACKWARD into the TAIL of the HELICOPT He slumps there, stunned -- and before he knows it, she's him. She grabs his THROAT with one hand and clamps the other a his CROTCH.  He tries to break her grip, but she's just a strong as he is.  And she's LIFTING him -- forcing him up toward the REAR STABILIZING ROTOR on the tail of the helicopter! The rear ROTOR BLADES WHINE LIKE A BUZZSAW as his head ri perilously closer.  At the last possible instant, he grab handful of her HAIR -- YANKS IT as hard as he can -- With a YOWL, she releases him.  They tumble to the roof a she DIVES ATOP HIM.  Her TALONS click into place -- he se them poised directly above his EYES -- -- but manages to slam an ELBOW under her chin before she strike.  Now they're disentangled; they get up groggily a circle each other... SOMEONE IS BANGING on the metal door that leads up to the roof, trying to break it down.  BATMAN turns for an insta a sudden CRACK -- -- and he finds himself all wrapped up in the CATWOMAN's O'-NINE-TAILS...which is also outfitted with a TASER.  Sh sends a PARALYZING ELECTRIC CHARGE through his body and h collapses to the roof in a jittering heap.  The BANGING o door is louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I invited company?  -- Keep 'em busy, angel, I've gotta scat. She kneels down and plants a BIG WET KISS on his twitchin face.  Then she scurries to the edge of the roof,

dialogues.speaker: DISAPPEARING --
dialogues.text: -- just as the DOOR gives way -- and an ARMED SWAT TEAM c crashing out onto the roof! Just coming around, BATMAN tries to roll out of sight -- the COPS are swarming the place.  They spot the BODIES on tar and gravel, see BATMAN scuttling for cover, and draw obvious conclusion.  Pulling guns, they OPEN FIRE.  BULLE RICOCHET off the big metal GLOBE. BATMAN, as is customary in these situations, shoots a GRAPPLING HOOK at the roof of the next building over -- w is a couple of stories taller than the Globe -- and REELS HIMSELF UPWARD along the side wall.  The SWAT COPS score couple of dead hits which set him swinging like a pendulu but his body armor holds and he clings to the line long e to reach the roof.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: FRlCK and FRACK, still in their Order-of-the-Bat garb, ar the front seats; the PENGUIN is leaning out the side door Someone's obviously tipped the COPS about the source of a the ruckus -- -- because a pair of POLICE CARS are on their tail and ga fast.  Still hanging in the doorway, the PENGUIN raises h UMBRELLA, peers down its length like a RIFLE SIGHT, and P A TRIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: A SONIC DART -- one of the PENGUIN'S BIRD MAGNETS -- lodg itself in the GRILLE of the foremost POLICE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: The COPS in the car react in astonishment as PIGEONS begi HURLING THEMSELVES at the WINDSHIELDS.  A DOZEN KAMIKAZE bounce off in rapid succession.  CRACKS begin to spread a the glass. The COPS can't see where they're driving.  The car SWERVE WILDLY.  And still the PIGEONS KEEP COMING -- COVERING TH WINDSHIELD -- TOTALLY OBSCURING THE STREETS FROM VIEW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first car, COMPLETELY COVERED WITH BIRDS, smacks into LAMPPOST and SKIDS.  The second car CRASHES INTO IT.  And pigeons continue to pour down from the heavens, SWARMING the immobilized squad cars.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN grins with delight as the van speeds off unmolested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that, boys -- they do flock together!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBULANCES are pouring into the square as the BAT ATTACK continues.  COPS are firing their guns blindly into the s as they try to evacuate the citizenry.  PARAMEDICS drop t stretcher they're carrying when BATS swoop down at their heads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN is still pursuing the CATWOMAN, who's perched one over, in a squat, wiggling a finger for him to follow.  T roofs are icy and treacherous, but he matches her step fo step, leap for leap, as she vaults from one building to t next, leading him on.  Finally she reaches the edge of a building on the corner of the block; there's no place to but down.  She squats on the ledge and smiles, beckoning him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh.  Where have you been all my life? He edges closer.  Suddenly, she does a BACKFLIP -- DIRECT OFF THE EDGE OF THE ROOF. BATMAN hears GLASS SHATTERING.  He hesitates a second -- closer to the edge of the roof -- PEERS OVER THE ICY CORN

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: Staring down, he sees a narrow LEDGE running around the f of the building some ten or twelve feet below.  The windo a corner apartment has been smashed; the curtains are fla in the chill wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's obviously making her getaway through the apartment. BATMAN climbs up on the slippery cornice and prepares to to the ledge below -- cautiously, because it's a long way down.  A sudden CRACK -- The CATWOMAN hasn't entered the apartment.  Instead, she' followed the ledge around the corner of the building, sil doubling back onto the roof behind BATMAN.  He TURNS just her WHIP wraps itself around his left leg.  She gives it sharp tug -- his feet SKID on the ice -- and HE TOPPLES O THE EDGE OF THE ROOF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunges downward for the briefest of seconds -- then J UP SHORT, SLAMMING INTO THE WALL OF THE BUILDING.  The WH has coiled itself around his leg, and for now it's holdin tight.  He's dangling upside down, bat-like; he bounces a from the wall; he SPINS in midair as one loop of the whip UNRAVELS, dropping him another foot or so. He manages to brace his left foot against the wall.  It's massive strain, but he's momentarily safe if he can keep moving.  The alternative is a twelve-story drop, straight to the pavement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's wrapped the handle-end of the whip around an expose pipe on the roof, anchoring BATMAN in place.  With a ches cat grin, she removes the RAVEN from her knapsack and hol on the edge of the cornice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN hanging immobile.  Craning his neck, he can just s the RAVEN STATUETTE on the ledge above him -- bouncing slight and apparently talking to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermore.  Nevermore! Now the CATWOMAN appears beside it -- elbows on the corni chin propped up on her folded hands, like a chatty girl a fern bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, huh! I think it'll look nice over the fireplace. Maybe you can drop by and see it sometime. (demurely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you won't think I'm too... aggressive or anything, but I find you very attractive. She toys aimlessly with the whipcord, batting at it like with a piece of yarn.  BATMAN grimaces.  She speaks in a soothing, seductive tone -- almost a purr.  Behind the bo mask she bats her eyelashes. CATWOMAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so hard to meet interesting men these days. Don't you think so? (sighing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have trouble with relationships.  Men find me intimidating...kind of predatory, you know?  Really I'm not.  Really I'm just playful... BATMAN huffs and puffs, trying to bend at the waist so he grab hold of the whip.  She frowns and YANKS on it.  His flies free of the wall, and another loop of the whip unco before he can stabilize himself. CATWOMAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh!  I'm trying to open up to you! Angrily, she holds a STEEL CLAW to the whip -- ready to c him loose.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: He's palmed the GRAPPLING-HOOK LAUNCHER from his belt. Holding it close to his body, out of view, he works it ar into firing position.  He'll shoot it right through her i has to... CATWOMAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always seem to fall for the wrong guys. You know...most men are rats.

dialogues.speaker: CATWOMAN
dialogues.text: She withdraws her hand from the whip, reverts to her philosphical mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mice, really. It's disgusting -- they beg you to walk all over them and then they whine when you do it. Once you've had your fun there's not much you can do but kill them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you seem different.  I mean, you obviously understand about dressing up... that saves a lot of explaining.  I think people should indulge their fantasies, don't you? BATMAN is sweating profusely.  He can't hold his position longer.  And the CATWOMAN is dragging this insane flirtat out endlessly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I think I'll let you live. Cute boys like you are hard to find... (standing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, angel.  I'll be thinking about you. And just like that, she VANISHES -- moving silently off w her raven, leaving BATMAN to dangle.  He hangs there a mo tries to twist himself around without moving his foot.  H braces one hand against the wall; with the other, he lift grappling gun and FIRES. The HOOK SNAGS somewhere on the roof.  BATMAN yanks the l taut and is laboriously trying to pull himself erect when -- the CATWOMAN reappears over the edge of the cornice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee...I'm so fickle. A QUICK SWIPE of her STEEL TALONS, and the whipcord is ne SEVERED.  BATMAN'S FOOT slips out from under him -- but h still got hold of the GRAPPLING GUN.  He DROPS eight or t feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching with amusement as BATMAN's weight causes the hoo DISLODGE.  It skitters across the gravel surface of the r and CATCHES, at the last instant, on the edge of the

dialogues.speaker: CORNICE --
dialogues.text: -- which promptly CRUMBLES and GIVES WAY.  Fascinated, th CATWOMAN leans over the edge of the roof and peers down..

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: He flails wildly, tangled in his cape, as the ground rush toward him.  He gets a last-ditch inspiration -- finds th CYLINDER on his belt and hits the switch.  The rods in hi cape begin to INFLATE... Six stories up, his BATWINGS spring erect, slowing his pl Five stories up, an UPDRAFT hits him and he suddenly INVE Four stories up, he rights himself.  Three stories up, he into a downward spiral, out of control, gliding in great arcs over the street... ...and a moment later there are no stories left.  With an crunch, he smacks into the slush-covered pavement and BOU Face down, he skids some twenty feet to a halt -- right i middle of a BUSY INTERSECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DELIVERY TRUCK hits the brakes and screeches to a stop, feet away from BATMAN'S HEAD.  He doesn't move.  PEDESTRI are already gawking and pointing as the DRIVER climbs out peers down at the inert caped figure lying face-down in t street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? CARS are backed up, due to the panic in Gotham Square a f blocks over.  HORNS are honking.  A TRAFFIC COP marches over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, what's the problem here? (spotting BATMAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He tries to clear the crowd away.  A full-fledged GRIDLOC forming around the prostrate BATMAN.  The COP blows his whistle, tries to maintain order as two unifonned PATROLM rush up to join him. They manage to roll the unconscious BATMAN over on his ba The assembled COPS stare down at the mask, the scuffed bo armor.  Still waxy, they finger the GUNS in their holster

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God.  Cowan -- get to the car -- radio the commissioner!! By now there must be two hundred people in the intersecti all surging forward to get a look.  More COPS are arrivin beat them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?  What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mask.  Get the mask off. They hunker down over BATMAN.  One of them tugs at his ma but the helmet-like cowl doesn't want to give way.  He fe around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kinda seam here on the neck... The PATROLMAN nods okay, and the COP tugs at a Velcro-lik fastening under BATMAN's chin.  The instant it comes open -- a BURST of FINE GREEN MIST spews forth from concealed in the gold-and-black BAT-EMBLEM, and the COPS reel backw shrieking, gasping for breath and clewing at their eyes. Booby-trap -- they've just been Maced. One of the ONLOOKING COPS steps back in horror and confus On impulse, he draws his gun and FIRES TWICE at BATMAN. body JERKS and the bullets RICOCHET OFF --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T SHOOT, you idiot.  The crowd -- Before he can finish, a BLACK BOOT kicks the gun out of t ONLOOKING COP's hand.  BATMAN is back among the living. SIRENS BLARE as he spins and rolls into a crouch -- lashi out with elbows and knees -- driving the cops back -- Fuck the crowd.  TWO MORE COPS pull their guns and open f in absolute panic.  BATMAN slams backward into the delive truck and crumples to the ground.  As he falls, he grabs couple of SMOKE CAPSULES from his belt and flings them to pavement. Seconds later, a THICK CLOUD OF BLACK SMOKE is spreading through the intersection.  BATMAN emerges into the midst the crowd -- weaving in and out among the stalled vehicle

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A MOUNTED COP rides up to the outer fringe of the traffic drawn by all the confusion.  He rears the horse back, tur in a circle; blows his piercing whistle as he tries to re the incoming cars... Suddenly a WIRE wraps itself around his chest and arms. looks down.  He sees a BATARANG in the instant before a s JERK pulls him cleanly off his mount. BATMAN climbs up on the hood of the nearest car -- vaults to the next -- and the next -- then hops into the saddle the MOUNTED COP's waiting HORSE.  He digs in his heels, maneuvering through traffic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT. EDDIE BULLOCK and another plainclothesman are a few b off trying to get through the jam.  Their siren is on, bu cars blocking their path have no room to pull over.  BULL grabs the radio mike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a mess up here, Commissioner. We'll have to go in on foot... As they wait for a response, they see a HORSE charging pa the opposite direction.  On the back of the horse...is BA Gaping, BULLOCK nudges his partner -- who throws the car immediately into REVERSE.  As they watch, BATMAN kicks th horse's flanks and turns right -- toward Gotham Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two RED BERETS, members of the Order of the Bat, are on n patrol, strolling down a rambling path near the entrance the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is wack, man.  Nothing ever happens around here anymore. The other RED BERET lets out a WHOOP OF FEAR and yanks hi partner out of the way.  They tumble into a snowdrift as BATMAN'S HORSE vaults over the stone wall of the park and gallops past, nearly trampling them in the process.  By n SQUAD CARS are roaring into the park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS BLARE and RED LIGHTS FLASH in the distance as the CARS spread out along the winding roads that run through park.  BATMAN reins the horse in suddenly as a black-and- whips past on an access road just ahead of him, no more t twenty yards away. He turns the horse in a circle.  MORE RED LIGHTS appear i distance; another contingent of SQUAD CARS has just enter from the opposite side of the park.  It's going to be tou getting out of here... Then: his eyes fall on the statue of his great-grandfathe GENERAL WAYNE -- two Waynes on horseback, not twenty feet apart.  He thinks back to his earlier conversation with V and gets an inspiration. He rides past General Wayne to the STONE BRIDGE which spa the little frozen creek.  There he finds the DRAINAGE TUN VICKI described, obscured by the wire-mesh grate.  This m be where the boy vigilante holes up... He dismounts, ties his CAPE to the pommel of the horse's saddle and sends it off with a slap.  He pries the grate and crawls inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dank, but cozy, hideout; WARM STEAM hisses from a grate the floor. RUMBLING SOUNDS fill the little chamber as a SUBWAY TRAIN passes directly underneath.  A little farther back there' ACCESS SHAFT, with a Jacob's ladder, leading to the train tracks below. Poking around, he finds a couple of cardboard BOXES -- th vigilante's stash.  The first contains tins of food, plus various odds and ends.  The second's more in line with wh needs -- it's full of OLD CLOTHING. A TRAIN rumbles past underneath.  BRUCE removes his COWL sets about putting together a civilian disguise that'll g him out of the park.  A wool hat and a long, moth-eaten topcoat: perfect.  As he's pulling them out of the box, h spies something extremely odd -- It's a COSTUME -- a spangled red-and-green GYMNASTS OUTFI with a little yellow CAPE -- neatly folded and in pristin condition.  He removes it carefully from the box and hold up in front of him.  Stitched on the vest is a single ini "R," in a black circle.  He stares at the whole mystifyin ensemble in complete befuddlement... The roar of the train subsides, and he hears a SCUFFLING NOISE.  Someone's in the tunnel with him.  He lowers the costume abruptly -- -- revealing DICK, the boy vigilante, who's crouched in f of him not three feet away.  The kid's just crawled up th the ACCESS SHAFT, and he's not at all happy to see an int messing with his stuff:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MINE! He lunges furiously at BRUCE.  The two of them tumble bac into the grate at the tunnel entrance, KNOCKING IT LOOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR streaks past on the bridge overhead mere sec before BRUCE and DICK roll out into the snow, still grapp BRUCE flings the kid into the bridge abutment.  DICK land hard; when he looks up, his EYES WIDEN, and a weird crook smile comes to his face... Out here in the moonlight he can see his opponent.  The b armor -- the gold-and-black emblem on the breastplate -- above it all, the face of BRUCE WAYNE, exposed to view... As a siren howls nearby, BRUCE flattens himself against t bridge.  Like it or not, his fate rests entirely in a str little boy's hands. The kid sizes up the situation immediately.  He nods his up and down.  Then he takes off his own ratty coat and th it to BRUCE. BRUCE is in no position to look a gift horse in the mouth pulls on the coat, gives DICK a nod of acknowledgement, a starts to move off.

dialogues.speaker: NO. WAIT
dialogues.text: BRUCE turns, uncertainly.  DICK throws him his woolen SKI The KID GIGGLES -- oddly, uncontrollably.  Then he sprint into the woods, dancing, leaping.  As he disappears from he lets out a shrill, piercing, almost FERAL SHRIEK -- -- which is obviously intended to divert the cops.  BRUCE makes haste in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE'S HORSE gallops through the trees, the black bat-ca still attached to its saddle and BILLOWING behind it.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: TWO COPS scanning the park.  The CAPED HORSE charges past front of them and is momentarily silhouetted in the headlights.  From a distance, it looks like BATMAN is sti the saddle. The COP at the wheel makes a sudden turn.  A moment later SLAMS ON THE BRAKES. A MAN has just stepped out onto the road, directly in the squad car's path -- a hunched figure in an old coat and w ski cap, obviously one of the homeless.  A COP leans on t horn and shouts out the window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb son of a bitch!! The MAN -- BRUCE -- steps back out of the squad car's pat The COPS take off -- in hot pursuit of a riderless horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR'S BAG rests on the kitchen table.  ALFRED, in ro and slippers, rummages inside it and comes up with an ACE BANDAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner Gordon called.  He wants to install a full contingent of police guards here at the manor -- in round-the-clock shifts -- to protect you from Batman. BRUCE is sitting erect in a straightbacked chair.  His sh is open and he's holding his arms aloft while ALFRED wrap full roll of adhesive tape around his battered RIBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  What'd you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him that since you were Batman, you'd require no protection from Batman. BRUCE makes a face: how droll.  ALFRED tears off the tape a brisk YANK -- and BRUCE lets out an involuntary YELP OF PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Alfred -- !!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In future, sir...I strongly advise against trying to fly off twenty-story buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a few bruises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One bruise, sir.  Which covers your entire body. BRUCE gets up -- stiffly -- and buttons his shirt in ging fashion while ALFRED packs his first-aid gear in the doct bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting too old for this line of work. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops placed me at the scene of the crime -- that weird kid of Vicki's saw my face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't worry overmuch.  I doubt the two of you move in the same circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and I got the living shit knocked out of me by a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- such outmoded sexist attitudes are quite unbecoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lavishly-appointed guest room on Gotham's Upper East (or equivalent thereof), we find a pair of PLAINCLOTHES C settled in for a stakeout: rumpled topcoats thrown across antique chairs, french-fry bags and GREASY BURGER WRAPPIN littering the carpet.  HIGH-POWERED RIFLES propped agains wall. They peer through venetian blinds at an ELEGANT OLD BROWN across the street...

dialogues.speaker: ROOF OF BROWNSTONE
dialogues.text: A UNIFORMED COP, also carrying a walkie-talkie, is keepin watch on the roof of the brownstone.  He signals "all cle to his counterpart watching from the house opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MORE PLAINCLOTHESMEN are parked at the end of the blo munching on donuts and watching the same brownstone.  The spot a POSTMAN lugging his sack up the tree-lined street his way to the brownstone.  One of the PLAINCLOTHESMEN pi up his RADIO MIKE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mailman's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POSTMAN marches up the front steps of the brownstone, sorting through letters and packages.  He hasn't even run bell when the door is opened by ANOTHER COP -- who snatch the mail delivery from his hands and SLAMS THE DOOR IN HI FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE COPS, at least half a dozen, are milling about insid unshaven, ties loosened, shirtsleeves rolled up.  They're for the long haul. The first COP gives a handful of letters to a couple of COLLEAGUES -- then hands over a PARCEL, wrapped in brown paper, to a pair of BOMB-DISPOSAL EXPERTS.  They carry it gingerly into the kitchen.  Into the midst of all this bustling activity strides COMMISSIONER GORDON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything suspicious! In the parlor, where all the shades are drawn, TWO COPS a examining each letter in turn, holding them up to a light bulb, CREASING THEM carefully before slitting them open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.  Christmas cards and bills. He anxiously watches their progress.  A VOICE calls from kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commissioner -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON enters.  The bomb-disposal boys have their equipme scattered all over the kitchen table.  They've slit the b paper wrapping of the PACKAGE, exposing a ROUND DECORATIV TIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fruitcake. He lifts the lid for GORDON to have a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Have it analyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bleary-eyed ELLIOTT TIPTREE marches down the stairs car a pair of OVERSIZED SUITCASES.  His WIFE and TWO KIDS are behind him -- all bundled up, preparing to embark on an extended vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tiptree?  The car's here. TIPTREE, fighting back tears, embraces his wife for a lon wordless moment.  Their LITTLE GIRL, aged six, tugs at Mo sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go to Grandma's.  I wanna stay here with Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a nice tree just like ours, honey.  Daddy'll be up as soon as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's old.  She doesn't even have cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about our presents? He gestures toward the GIFTS piled high around the tree i parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I'll bring 'em up with me. We'll open 'em when I get there. TIPTREE forces a smile for the kids.  He CLUTCHES his wif hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, folks, but we'd better move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids?  Tell your Daddy goodbye... Tearful hugs all around; then a cadre of UNIFORMED COPS e MRS. TIPTREE and the KIDS to the door.  TIPTREE pulls GOR aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be safe, won't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As safe as we can make 'em. (beat; sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would help if you could give us some small hint what this is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.  I... TIPTREE shrugs helplessly and stares at his shoes.  GORDO convinced he's holding something back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what was in that box that Provost had delivered from the bank. TIPTREE shakes his head wearily.  GORDON glowers as he tu to go. GORDON (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mr. Tiptree.  Merry Christmas. GORDON exits.  TIPTREE wanders listlessly into the living room, pulls back the drapes, and WATCHES as his wife and ride off in a convoy of POLICE CARS.  One of the COPS tri pull him away from the window, but he refuses to move... ...until a PHONE RINGS.  Everyone jumps at once.  A TECHN hits a switch on a loudspeaker-and-tape-recorder assembly then gestures for TIPTREE to pick up the receiver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tiptree?  Andy here.  Listen -- we've got a chance to grab a good-sized block of Atlantic Teledyne at twenty-six and an eighth -- The COPS heave sighs and turn off their tracing equipment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
