dialogues.text: Not today, Andy.  Let's talk after New Year's. TIPTREE hangs up and starts to BAWL right there in the mi of the room.  The COPS turn away in sympathetic embarrass as he goes to a corner wet bar and pours himself a good s jolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallowing in despair, TIPTREE sits at an antique secretar composing a LETTER.  He takes a long pull on a glass of Scotch, signs his name, and inserts the letter into an envelope.  He opens the desk drawer -- takes a long look .38 automatic stashed inside -- then finds a stamp and af it to the envelope.  He addresses it to BRUCE WAYNE. A moment later he hears a noise at the window: TINK TINK He peers through the blinds and sees a CARRIER PIGEON on ledge outside -- pecking at the glass, asking to come in. He raises the window and the PIGEON hops fearlessly insid onto the sill.  The bird, well-trained, struggles only slightly as he unties a tiny CAPSULE from its leg and rem a FOLDED NOTE.  Scrawled across it is a handwritten messa

dialogues.speaker: IF POLICE SEE THIS YOUR FAMILY IS DEAD
dialogues.text: He opens the note and begins to read as the PIGEON takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE is at his desk examining the morning editions.  A B HEAD-LINE shrieks: BATMAN SOUGHT IN PUBLISHER'S MURDER Bat Attack Panics Gotham Square

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J. Harrison Provost, 41, Leaves Distinguished Legacy He hears a VISITOR arriving in the entry hall.  He gets u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE ambles out and sees SELINA, who's just arrived, doi her patetented thing on ALFRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English accents are so stimulating. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the most beautiful silver hair! ALFRED stammers as she reaches up to STROKE HIS HAIR.  He about to break into a sweat.  He's eminently relieved whe turns and sees -- SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selina.  What are you doing here? ALFRED affects a look of grandmotherly outrage as SELINA slinks over and takes BRUCE by the arm.  She's on him lik barnacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see your things, remember? And I got tired of waiting for you to call me back. (gesturing toward ALFRED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's adorable.  How long have you had him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE leads SELINA down a hallway to the armory.  He glan back over his shoulder and sees ALFRED peering snoopily a the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard about Harry Provost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredibly awful. It got me a little worried. (sidling up closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to think of something happening to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's odd, though.  Danger, the thought of suddenly dying -- in a weird way it gets you sort of...aroused.  Don't you think? BRUCE cocks an eyebrow at her.  Everything gets her sort aroused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA BEAMS at the fantastic collection of armored gear exotic weapons.  She's like a kid in a toy shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, this is incredible. (indicating a suit of armor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malaysian -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.  Sarawak warrior caste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like -- everything in here is another little piece of your mind. I was right about you. (turning to face him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise, okay?  Promise you'll show me every inch of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED is at a PRINTER, scanning page after page of compu printout.  He delivers his findings to BRUCE, who's seate a nearby terminal, scanning data and tapping away at the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police have no files whatsoever on Selina Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abstractedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London...Cairo...Belgium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her credit card records. (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every major art theft in the last five years -- she's been on the scene or close to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean she's some sort of -- collector? A...cat burglar, or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be. Museum curator, authenticator -- she's got the perfect cover for it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would she want with that stupid raven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raven, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the Catwoman took from Provost. A little raven statuette, about so big... (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it couldn't have been that valuable. He continues to scan the screen.  ALFRED is suddenly lost thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How very odd. (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's nothing, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father had a raven, sir.  A small statue of the very sort you describe.  It used to sit on his desk. This piques BRUCE's interest.  He swivels around in his c and stares directly up at ALFRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After your father's...demise, Mr. Tiptree came to the house and asked if he could have it. As a keepsake. I saw no harm... (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was thirty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  Mr. Tiptree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Tiptree.  Your friend Elliott's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE has an oversized suitcase open on the bed.  It's -- except for the BALLED-UP WADS of NEWSPAPER which he's stuffing inside it.  His head turns suddenly at the sound the doorbell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE emerges from his bedroom and peers over a bannist into the ENTRYWAY below.  Standing there is an unexpected visitor -- BRUCE WAYNE -- holding his arms aloft while a battery of COPS pat him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for -- Batarangs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce! Come on up. (to the COPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Mr. Wayne alone. The COPS look on suspiciously as BRUCE ascends the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE lets BRUCE inside and shuts the door behind him. BRUCE hands him a GIFT BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you a Christmas present.  Sorry about the wrapping -- the police made me open it. TIPTREE opens the box and pulls out a diamond-studded TIE CLASP.  He looks up at BRUCE with an odd mixture of bewilderment and gratitude.  BRUCE nods for him to try it and he obliges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm afraid I don't have anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you may have something that belonged to my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You know? He stares at BRUCE, astonished.  His head sinks into his hands. TIPTREE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll all be over tomorrow. One way or another, it'll all be over. (looking up; despondent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've decided, Bruce.  I'm gonna give him the last two ravens.  He's already got the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman.  I don't know how he found out, but -- TIPTREE reaches for the bottle on his desk to pour himsel drink, but BRUCE angrily knocks the glass out of his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time you told me what's going on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you ever wonder where it came from, Bruce? All the privilege, all the power ...all the money? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ravens are a...a kind of map, Bruce. The key to an incredibly vast fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose fortune?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotham City's.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The cobblestone streets of 19th-Century Gotham.  A massiv EXPLOSION blows open one wall of a municipal building, an total CHAOS erupts: fires starting, BYSTANDERS screaming, POLICE rushing to the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1880 the Gotham City Treasury was looted.  It was a fantastic operation -- perfect military precision.  The robbers made off with milllons in gold and silver bullion... A HORSE-DRAWN CART weighted down with gold bricks careens around a corner.  Atop it are two men in MASKS, firing a GATLING GUN into the crowd.  POLICE and ONLOOKERS tumble the pavement, shot dead, as ANOTHER CART emerges from the wreckage of the treasury and takes off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: CITY OFFICIALS in a boardroom trading papers back and for arguing furiously with five calm, distinguished-looking G -- one of whom is the bushy-bearded Civil War hero GEN. O WAYNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city was going under.  Bankrupt... until five rich men stepped in to bail it out.  In exchange they took the land rights, the mineral rights, the service contracts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Five Families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ancestors. They bought Gotham City -- carved it up and ran it into the ground. In five years they were rich beyond imagining. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've just been following in their footsteps.  And in all this time no one's ever suspected --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that they were the ones behind the robbery?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The FIVE PATRIARCHS in front of a roaring fireplace at Wa Manor, raising a celebratory toast.  CAMERA PANS OVER to nearby table; on it rest FIVE RAVEN STATUETTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had five ravens made. Five ravens which -- combined -- would reveal the location of the treasure they'd stolen. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they never touched it.  They never needed to.  It's still there to this day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ravens, and the secret -- have been passed down through generations. Father to son... (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father -- died before he could tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they stole his piece of the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I've got it, Bruce, and I'm going to hand it over.  He's right, you know. We've all been feeding -- feeding on the soul of Gotham... BRUCE stares at him, stony-faced.  There's one part of th story that doesn't quite add up. BRUCE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you, Elliott.  My father was a decent man -- an honorable man.  He would never have taken part in a scheme like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't his doing, Bruce.  It was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter. If he knew that his fortune was based on a crime -- a crime against the city... (violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reputation or not, he would've tried to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Bruce!  Do you want me to spell it out for you?!? BRUCE backs off.  An awful shiver of anticipation runs do his spine. TIPTREE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a decent man.  He was an honorable man.  That's why they had him killed. CAMERA ZEROES IN ON BRUCE'S HORRIFIED FACE as we get a

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Quick, almost subliminal glimpses of BRUCE's primal traum MUGGER snatching at his mother's necklace.  THOMAS WAYNE lunging at him.  The young JACK NAPIER firing at THOMAS. PEARLS showering down on the rain-drenched sidewalk.  A s bullet felling his MOTHER -- -- and finally, young BRUCE himself, face wracked with PA and GRIEF --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: -- an expression which perfectly matches the one which th adult BRUCE is wearing as he relives it all thirty years later.  Staggered and glassy-eyed, he stares off into spa TIPTREE finishes his tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed him...to protect their secret ...and now the bill's come due.  Now the bill's come due.

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD DUSK
dialogues.text: The wrought-iron gate outside BRUCE's vast estate -- and beyond it, Wayne Manor itself, rising bold and stately ag the setting sun.  A COUNTY SHERIFF'S CAR cruises past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE lies motionless on his bed.  Scattered about him ar SCRAPBOOKS, FAMILY PHOTOS and yellowed NEWSPAPER CLIPPING which describe the murder of his parents.  Disoriented, h gazes about aimlessly at his familiar surroundings -- whi longer seem quite so familiar... He folds his arms formally across his chest and stares up the ceiling, inert, as if the very weight of his heritage crushing him down.  Somewhere, a PHONE RINGS.  He makes n move to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI's at the kitchen table drinking coffee.  ALFRED, wh in his apron preparing dinner, picks up the ringing phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, yes, everything's fine. I'll expect your next call in an hour. (hanging up; to VICKI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are becoming an awful nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so awful for him, Alfred.  There must be something we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realized long ago -- that there are places in Mr. Wayne's heart which no one will ever penetrate -- or share. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves you, Miss Vale.  But in certain ways he will always be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Thanks for the testimonial. ALFRED turns and sees BRUCE standing in the doorway, star at him.  He starts to say something, but thinks better of He returns to his dinner preparations as BRUCE sits down across from VICKI.  She extends a hand and he takes it -- making a visible effort to hold himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiptree's planning some kind of rendezvous with 'Batman.'  I think Batman ought to be there when it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see, sir.  When shall we expect you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your cap.  You're driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, and the house is dark as TIPTREE treeds silent downstairs carrying an OVERSIZED SUITCASE.  The lights ar in the kitchen, where the COPS are playing poker and watc TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS TREE LIGHTS twinkle in the darkness.  TIPTREE k beside the tree and digs around among the packages.  He p out an OBLONG GIFT BOX with a tag addressed "TO DADDY --

dialogues.speaker: SANTA."
dialogues.text: With a glance back at the kitchen, he soundlessly unwraps package -- and opens it to reveal a matched set of RAVEN STATUETTES.  He transfers them to the big suitcase -- the slinks into the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two STAKEOUT COPS are chuckling at a Charlie Brown Christmas special on a portable TV.  One of them glances the window and sees a man in a topcoat emerging from the brownstone, SUITCASE in hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- that's Tiptree!! The COP grabs for his WALKIE-TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE is halfway down the block when two COPS burst out the brownstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tiptree!  What the hell are you -- HEADLIGHTS FLASH ON as the SURVEILLANCE CAR revs its engi TIPTREE breaks into a RUN -- and the COPS from the browns follow suit.  At the end of the block he vanishes down a SUBWAY ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VIOLINIST is panhandling outside the token booth as the come racing down the stairs.  The COPS trip over his open violin case, scattering small change across the conrete f They flash their badges at the booth and VAULT OVER THE

dialogues.speaker: TURNSTILE --
dialogues.text: -- just in time to see TIPTREE, with his SUITCASE, scuttl down a stairway which leads to the train platform below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE steps onto an EXPRESS TRAIN.  The doors slide shu behind him -- and the hapless COPS curse under their brea he rolls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta get back to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE takes an open seat and looks around apprehensivel Being fabulously rich, be's probably ridden the subway tw in his life -- and at this time of night, EVERY FACE in t sparsely-populated car looks vaguely menacing.  Derelicts prostitutes, teen-gang members -- ALL OF THEM eye this we heeled stranger with intense curiosity as he clutches his suitcase and stares anxiously at the floor... An ODD, GAUNT FIGURE enters at the end of the car.  It's DEAFMUTE.  He shambles down the aisle passing out little CARDS.  One side is a guide to International Sign Languag The other reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO YOUNG TOUGHS take a card and tear it in half, chuckli shining the DEAFMUTE on.  A HOOKER, the heart-of-gold typ stuffs a buck in his tin cup.  He reaches TIPTREE and ext a card; TIPTREE ignores him, refusing to make eye contact -- but the DEAFMUTE shoves the card insistently into his Now TIPTREE looks up.  THIS CARD bears a personalized mes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-TRAIN WEST TO RIVERVIEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE's eyes widen.  The DEAFMUTE -- who is in fact FRI glowers down and holds out his cup.  TIPTREE digs in his pocket; the smallest bill he's got is a twenty, but he ha it over anyway. Smiling at this act of generosity, FRICK moves on to the car.  TIPTREE stares down tremulously at the card.  He fi with his TIE CLASP -- the one BRUCE gave him earlier...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: TIGHT on a hand-held ELECTRONIC TRACING DEVICE.  A small moves across a shifting GRID not unlike a radar screen. BRUCE is in the back of the limo, eyeing the tracer inten ALFRED's up front, at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to this, he's directly below us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subway, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Take a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's slightly more crowded here in the hub of Gotham.  TI emerges onto the platform and spies a squad of TRANSIT CO thirty or forty feet away -- speaking into WALKIE-TALKIES they scan the crowd. Sticking close to the tracks, he turns swiftly toward the nearest stairway -- blending in with the crowd, trying to the SUITCASE out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIPTREE IS RUNNING for the B-train just as the doors begi close.  He manages to thrust the suitcase inside -- but t doors SLIDE SHUT on his hand, and he DROPS IT.  He stands there on the platform, his face turning BONE WHITE as the train lurches forward... False alarm.  The train stops, and the doors hiss open ag

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: TIPTREE clambers aboard with a severe case of palpitation As the train pulls out, a couple of rough-looking but hel STREET TYPES show him to a seat and hand him his precious suitcase.  He sits there panting... Moments later, a DEAFMUTE enters the car.  TIPTREE does a take: it's the exact same guy who was riding the other li Of course, he doesn't know about Frick's malignant twin - FRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having changed trains twice more since we left him, TIPTR debarks at a deserted local stop.  The station is EMPTY e for one other passenger, who's gotten off here as well -- WOMAN in a long fur coat. TIPTREE WATCHES as she approaches on her way to the stair STILLETO HEELS clicking across the floor.  There's someth familiar about her -- but she's wearing a big, broad-brim hat, and she TILTS IT DOWN as she passes, obscuring her f It is, of course, SELINA... TIPTREE stands there expectantly with his suitcase, await further instructions.  They aren't long in coming.  A BLA MYNAH BIRD swoops out of the tunnel, lands on the platfor and STRUTS in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW ME. AWWWKK
dialogues.text: The bird flutters its wings and takes off again -- INTO T TUNNEL.  TIPTREE stares after it in disbelief.  Then the CAWS AGAIN -- its shrill voice echoing from the darkness the tunnel:

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW ME. AWWWKK
dialogues.text: TIPTREE clambers over the edge of the platform, dropping awkwardly to the tracks below.  Suitcase in hand, he begi walk...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: ALFRED tearing up the streets as BRUCE consults his trace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's slowed down.  Looks like he's under the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you propose to get down there, sir? We can't have Batman strolling up to buy a token.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know another way in. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step on it.  They're down there waiting for him. ALFRED turns the limo hard right -- into GOTHAM PARK -- p the statue of GENERAL WAYNE atop his horse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOCAL TRAIN roars by, filling the screen.  When it pass we see TIPTREE with his suitcase, walking along the expre tracks at the far wall of the tunnel -- more frightened w each step.  It's dark and eerie down here in the tunnels; only illumination comes from dim LANTERNS spaced at fifty intervals. He sees the lights of an EXPRESS TRAIN behind him, and qu switches to the local tracks.  The train rumbles past wit deafening blare, and the car lights briefly illuminate hi surroundings.  TIPTREE glances over at the inside wall of tunnel... ...where he sees, huddled in an ALCOVE just off the track small gathering of HOMELESS PEOPLE.  They've set up camp here in the tunnels, away from the elements.  Surrounded bags full of old clothes, DINING on canned food and cheap wine, they stare curiously at the well-heeled stranger wi the suitcase who's invaded their domain. TIPTREE eyes them fearfully and picks up his pace, hasten down the tunnel.  The HOMELESS make no move to follow -- one exception.  A KID, thirteen or fourteen, in a ratty topcoat, climbs down onto the tracks and watches inquisit as TIPTREE vanishes into the shadows. His face is familiar.  It's DICK -- the boy vigilante fro park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this stretch of the tunnel the LANTERNS don't seem to working -- and the MYNAH is completely invisible.  When h comes to a fork in the tracks, he has to wait for the sou the bird's shrill voice to guide him:

dialogues.speaker: AWWRRK
dialogues.text: TIPTREE stumbles ahead blindly in the darkness.  He trips the tracks and drops the suitcase.  As he's getting to hi feet, a FLASHLIGHT shines DIRECTLY IN HIS FACE...

dialogues.speaker: STOP THERE.
dialogues.text: The MYNAH BIRD flutters through the beam of light and per on the shoulder of an UNSEEN FIGURE.  TIPTREE COWERS and SQUINTS, trying to make him out, but the figure who stand before him is shielding his face with an open UMBRELLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've cooperated.  I've done everything you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the case. TIPTREE lifts the lid, revealirig TWO RAVENS in the suitc A CACKLING LAUGH echoes in the darkness. PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Two ravens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one is Bruce Wayne's. (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know anything about this. You've got what you want.  There's no need to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Tiptree.  You may go. TIPTREE stands.  He backs away from the suitcase warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family.  You won't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll certainly take your unexpected generosity into consideration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We -- ?!? (shielding his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Batman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm his brother-in-law -- Birdman. Now move out.

dialogues.speaker: THAT MOMENT
dialogues.text: TIPTREE marches slowly down the tracks, TOWARD CAMERA, silhouetted in the flashlight beam.  The beam SHIFTS SLIG as the Penguin moves toward the suitcase and sets the lig down -- -- and we catch sight of the CATWOMAN perched on a steel cross-girder above the rails, her CHROME-STEEL TALONS GLI as she waits for TIPTREE to pass underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking increasingly twitchy as he approaches the cross- girder.  He slips a hand into the pocket of his topcoat,

dialogues.speaker: WHIRLS SUDDENLY --
dialogues.text: -- and brings up his .38 AUTOMATIC, firing THREE QUICK SH at the PENGUIN.  The shots RICOCHET LOUDLY off the umbrel which happens to be a bulletproof job.  The PENGUIN lifts brolly; FIRE SPITS out of the shaft -- -- and TIPTREE staggers backward.  SHOT IN THE CHEST.  He spins into a steel upright and topples, face-forward, ont ELECTRIFIED THIRD RAIL -- FRYING HIMSELF in a shower of sparks. The smoke is still clearing when the CATWOMAN drops to th tracks.  The PENGUIN rushes to her side to check TIPTREE signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That idiot.  Another six feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sorry to spoil your fun.  -- He brought two ravens.  We've got a complete set!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  They're in the suitcase -- An AWFUL RUMBLING fills the tunnel.  They see the lights TRAIN approaching on the center track -- the same one the standing on, the one TIPTREE's body is slumped across.  T PENGUIN's first impulse is to run back toward the inner t where the ravens lie, but the CATWOMAN is trying to drag TIPTREE out of the train's path...

dialogues.speaker: GIVE ME A HAND
dialogues.text: They pull the corpse onto the outer express track just as train arrives.  They stand against the outer wall, waitin the train to pass... ...and when it does, they see DICK -- the boy vigilante - standing on the inner track directly across from them. HOLDING THE SUITCASE.  The kid takes off like a shot.  Th CATWOMAN and the PENGUIN exchange quick looks of utter disbelief -- and BOLT AFTER DICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bulky suitcase is slowing his progress.  He looks bac over his shoulder; although the stubby-legged PENGUIN has fallen well behind, the CATWOMAN is gaining fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching in the light from the train as the two costumed figures grapple in the distance.  He races back toward th scene of the melee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where BATMAN and the CATWOMAN are trading punches, blo blow. He knocks her off her feet with a vicious right ho and she sprawls on the track, dazed and bleeding. She li hand: no mas... He looks back toward the suitcase on the center track. B he can make a move toward it, he spots ANOTHER TRAIN approaching on the outer tracks -- right on the heels of last one. He crouches to pull the CATWOMAN's limp frame of its path... ...but as he does so, a HORN BLARES -- and a SECOND TRAIN comes barrelling down the center track from the opposite direction! Now he's got trains approaching on either sid and there's no place to go -- The CATWOMAN is groggily getting to her feet. He LUNGES her -- THRUSTS HER BACKWARD, toward an ALCOVE in the oute tunnel wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OUTER train is already speeding past, obscuring BATMA the CATWOMAN from view.  The CENTER train is bearing down fast.  A split-second before it arrives, DICK'S HAND snat the suitcase out of its path -- and he TUMBLES TO SAFETY the innermost LOCAL TRACK. He stands and watches as the two trains pass in opposite directions.  He doesn't know if BATMAN is alive or dead..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN and CATWOMAN are flattened in the tiny alcove -- there's not two inches of breathing space between them an passing TRAIN.  She's come around now, and she's FLAILING CLAWING at him, trying to PUSH HIM OUT. HER HAND closes around his UTILITY BELT.  As they struggl she hits the trigger of a SMALL GAS CYLINDER... It's BRUCE's hydraulic BATWING DEVICE -- the one that sav him when he fell off the roof.  But this time the results altogether different.  He GASPS IN HORROR as the WINGS OF CAPE stiffen and inflate -- FORCING HIM AWAY FROM THE WAL THE TUNNEL. His OUTER WING strikes the TRAIN -- FLAPPING WILDLY again the passing CARS -- SNAGGING FINALLY on the ralling of th rearmost car -- -- and BATMAN is suddenly RIPPED OUT OF THE ALCOVE -- DRA OFF DOWN THE TRACKS by the passing train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still there with the suitcase -- waiting apprehensiv to see what's become of BATMAN.  Finally the center train passes -- -- and he sees CATWOMAN standing ALONE IN THE ALCOVE -- smiling at him -- advancing menacingly.  DICK TURNS TO RU A GUNSHOT rings out -- and the last thing he sees as he s to the tracks is a whiff of SMOKE pluming from the shaft the PENGUIN'S UMBRELLA. The PENGUIN's panting -- soaked with sweat.  The CATWOMAN snatches up the suitcase and rushes over to join him.  Sh peers off into the tunnels after BATMAN, exhilarated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.  Did you see him? Isn't he hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you got anything else to think about? (mopping sweat from his brow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hot.  That was exhausting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pain, no gain!  -- Suck it up.  We're not out of here yet. She sprints off down the tracks.  SQUAWKING, he waddles a behind her, as fast as his fat little legs will carry him As they vanish into the darkness, the CAMERA TRACKS back past DICK, who lies unconscious on the tracks, bleeding heavily from his shoulder wound -- DEEPER INTO THE MAZE O

dialogues.speaker: TUNNELS --
dialogues.text: -- arriving finally on the ragged black figure of BATMAN staggers forth from the shadows, dazed and bloody.  He sc the tunnel, finding no trace of his enemies -- and then h gaze falls on DICK. He limps over and KNEELS at the boy's side -- cradling hi head protectively, staring helplessly into the blackness around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stark outlines of the city, BATHED IN MOONLIGHT.  CAM ZEROES IN on the glowing, ornamental DOME of CITY HALL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PENTAGONAL BALCONY girds the interior of the dome.  We DOWN to ground level -- where TWO AGED SECURITY GUARDS li sprawled at odd angles on the marble floor, FATALLY SHOT. The PENGUIN closes his gun-umbrella and waddles across th atrium of City Hall, past a statue of blind Justice, to a point directly under the dome.  There, encased in a plexi case, is a SCALE MODEL of GOTHAM CITY -- circa 1885, when Hall was erected.  He shouts up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CATWOMAN, FRICK, and FRACK are already up on the balc Lining its periphery are various DISPLAY CASES of histori interest; and positioned along the wall at each point of pentagon are FIVE ARCHED NICHES -- each one containing a bronze bust.  The patriarchs of Gotham's Five Families... The CATWOMAN and co. go to work quickly.  She removes the RAVENS from a gunny sack as FRICK and FRACK work their wa around the balcony, YANKING the busts from their recessed bases.  She follows along behind them, replacing each bus with a RAVEN. When they're done, the PENGUIN yells up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.  Give each raven a quarter-turn. His pals in the dome oblige -- TWISTING each raven in its recessed socket, in quick succession...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment of maximum tension.  He stands there frothing the mouth with anticipation.  SECONDS TICK OFF, and nothi happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  That's all...! He looks around expectantly as the others peer down at hi from above.  He really doesn't know what's supposed to ha next.  Suspecting the worst, he throws his umbrella to th floor and begins STAMPING ABOUT IN A RAGE, SPUTTERING, flapping his arms like wings. PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been TRICKED!  It's a HOAX!  It's a -- He SHUTS UP suddenly at the sound of a loud CHUNK.  Somew behind him, ANCIENT GEARS are beginning to grind.  He spi and stares at the SCALE MODEL of GOTHAM in its plexiglass case... The city model is TREMBLING slightly.  As he watches, the of the miniature CITY HALL -- in the dead center of the m city -- POPS OFF on a hinge.  A METAL STRONGBOX rises int view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CATWOMAN, FRICK and FRACK stare down at the little me box.  The PENGUIN is already clambering atop the plexigla case of the model, SMASHING AT IT with his umbrella, tryi get at the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the treasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's a map... She affixes a ROPE to the balcony railing and CLIMBS OVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plexiglass case finally SHATTERS -- and the PENGUIN f through, landing atop Gotham City.  He snatches at the strongbox and gets to his feet, bestriding the city like colossus.  He's climbing down off the tabletop when the CATWOMAN, on her rope, touches down behind him. He hunkers down on the floor and knocks the rusted padloc the box.  He opens it and stares greedily at the contents MAP and a bunch of old, crumbling PHOTOS.  The CATWOMAN c over to his side:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce Wayne. So he doesn't know a thing about the treasure, eh...? (handing her the map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.  It's right under Wayne Manor.  It's been there all along! Now the CATWOMAN snatches at the PHOTOS.  They show progressively closer views of ANCIENT GNARLED STALACTITES an odd, distinctive SUBTERRANEAN ROCK FORMATION... PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like some kind of cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE FACE of DICK.  He lies unconscious in a big frilly bed A WOMAN'S HAND wipes his feverish brow with a cloth; he moans slightly... His eyes snap open suddenly.  He sits BOLT UPRIGHT with a yelp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no -- don't try to get up -- you're hurt. He pushes her aside and climbs out of bed anyway.  His shoulder is bandaged, his arm in a sling.  The pajamas he wearing are three sizes too large.  He paces about, stari his unfamiliar surroundings. VICKI (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.  You're safe.  You can stay here as long as you need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't belong here.  You can't keep me here. Vaguely unnerved, he goes to a window, pulls back the sha looks out at the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's "Dick", isn't it?  Or do you prefer "Richard"? He stares at her as if she's nuts.  VICKI opens a closet all of his ratty belongings are hanging inside -- includi the red-and-green GYMNAST'S SUIT with the "R" insigne on breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "R" -- for Richard, right? See, all your things are here... (staring at the costume)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, some kind of gymnast's outfit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of your business.  What is this, some kind of home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that kind.  There's a swimming pool -- tennis court -- you can have anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennis court?!  -- Lady, you're rich.  How the hell would you know what I want? VICKI tries to lay a soothing arm on his shoulder.  He ba away, pushes her aside and turns toward the door in agitation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying.  You can't make me -- -- and sees BRUCE standing in the doorway looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make you. DICK freezes -- as if BRUCE's mere presence has mesmerize him.  The hint of a smile plays across his face: ohhhhh. in Batman's house. BRUCE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Wanna go at it? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, kid -- like it or not, you're my guest -- and long as you're here you might as well enjoy it. ALFRED appears with a tray of hot food and sets it down o bedside table.  DICK edges toward it and sits down.  He w for ALFRED to leave and then TUCKS IN HUNGRILY -- eyeing all the while. BRUCE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you two be okay in here? VICKI nods yes.  BRUCE backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE pulls the door shut.  ALFRED follows him down the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you propose to do with him, sir? Keep him in the room for the rest of his life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Alfred.  I've got other stuff to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child is hurt, sir.  At the very least we should attempt to locate his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't got any parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that, sir? BRUCE turns and fixes ALFRED with a steely gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I know. The PHONE RINGS as BRUCE starts down the long stairway. ALFRED picks up a hallway extension.  He covers the mouthpiece:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- it's Miss Kyle. BRUCE rushes back upstairs to take the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARCTIC BIRDS chirping all around in the penguin-pool room SNOW OWL struts across the PENGUIN's desk as SELINA makes phone call -- with the PENGUIN, FRICK, and FRACK hovering her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!  Tall, dark and handsome.  Are we still on for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He covers the receiver and stares intensely at ALFRED.  O look we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas carols playing.  VICKI's got DICK helping her t the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUCE is getting dressed for his date with SELINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this necessary, sir?  After all...it is Christmas eve. BRUCE reaches for his UTILITY BELT.  He empties the conte of one packet onto a dresser: a dozen tiny, red GLASSINE CAPSULES.  He scoops up a handful of the CAPSULES and dep them in his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff'll knock out a moose, much less a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to see you going out on a date...unprotected, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be ready for Batman -- but not for me. (turning to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way, Alfred.  I've got to take her out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK watches from the front parlor as VICKI meets BRUCE a bottom of the stairs.  The two of them exchange a few bri words; he embraces her, strokes her hair gently -- then g sets his jaw and moves off toward the front door. VICKI reenters the parlor, trying to force an expression cheer as DICK turns discreetly away.  This is one weird household he's landed in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOFT MUSIC plays in the background as SELINA preens in fr of a vanity, doing her eye makeup, taking great pleasure her own reflection.  She's looking especially sultry toni in a glittering low-cut gown.  She lowers one shoulder st and strikes a pose in the mirror: better.  She runs a han through her hair, TOUSLING IT for that recently-ravished The DOORBELL rings, and by the time SELINA crosses over t answer it, she's lowered the other strap as well -- which means she has to hold up the top of her dress with one ha BRUCE finds himsell dumbstruck as she lets him in.  She p up both straps as she greets him nonchalantly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're early.  I'm afraid I'm not quite dressed. BRUCE enters and takes a long look around.  It's a big op loft, only partly finished, filled with Egyptian artifact The walls feature modern paintings with CAT MOTIFS.  The finished section is dominated by a huge BED on a raised platform -- three or four CATS are walking around on it, yowling at BRUCE.  SELINA CHUCKLES as he scopes it all ou SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking for my bondage gear, it's at the cleaners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas eve.  No tree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No presents.  I've been a bad girl this year. BRUCE takes a seat on the sofa while SELINA goes to a nea wet bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you kept this date.  I thought you would've lost interest by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got what you want, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do now. (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had this date for a long, long time. With that, she sets the drinks down on the table and move to KISS him -- a long, slow, wet kiss.  But BRUCE seems strangely unresponsive.  She breaks free and gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is it going to cost me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...To get the ravens back. He watches her closely for a reaction.  SELINA's shocked, she conceals it well -- chuckling in apparent confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the oddest man I've ever met. (moving in on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk later, Bruce.  I've got kind of a short fuse... BRUCE tenses slightly as she KISSES him again -- leaving crimson LIPSTICK SMEAR on his cheek.  She works her way downward, kissing him around his neck and throat... HIS HAND reaches into his jacket pocket.  He withdraws a GLASSINE CAPSULE.  But before he can use it -- He JERKS BACK suddenly -- pushes her away.  His free hand to his neck, where a thin trickle of BLOOD is oozing from between two bright red LIPSTICK LIPS.  She's bitten him.. Now she SHUSHES him -- reaches over to the tiny wound and massages it gently with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hurt you?  Just relax -- you'll start to enjoy it. BRUCE pulls away again.  His eyes are strangely glazed. tries to speak, but his tongue feels thick and swollen. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, you look faint.  It must be the cats. BRUCE stands suddenly.  It's as if he's mired in a slo-mo nightmare.  His legs give way beneath him and he topples the floor, INERT.  His fingers go slack and the capsule r out; he tries to reach into his pocket, but his arm won't to work. SELINA's cat, HECATE, strolls across his prostrate form - purring and stretching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worm's-eye view -- SELINA looms over him with a predato smile on her face, shifting in and out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What di-- what did you d-- She runs a finger across her lips and holds it up -- brig red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I've...gotten under your skin.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: His hand goes to the BITE on his neck -- and he realizes SELINA's lipstick is spiked with a fast-acting PARALYTIC He writhes helplessly on the carpet, his whole body gradu going slack. The PENGUIN, FRICK and FRACK stroll through the doorway a stand over him -- ALL LAUGHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COUNTY SHERIFF'S CAR cruises past the manor, right on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED on the telephone, checking in with the County Sher boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, thank you.  We'll talk in an hour. Behind him, VICKI is waiting up for BRUCE.  She's curled the sofa, reading a book, throwing the occasional anxious glance at a big grandfather clock -- which strikes eleven o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK opens the bedroom door and peeks down the hall.  He' all his belongings tied up in a bundle on the bed; he ope window and throws the bundle outside. There's a nice strong TREE BRANCH some ten or twelve feet the window -- just close enough that he should be able to it.  He climbs up onto the windowsill, crouches, and SPRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car full of trouble: SELINA, wearing a fur coat over he Catwoman garb, at the wheel; the PENGUIN riding shotgun; FRICK in the back seat -- next to BRUCE, who's semi-consc and stone limp.  The car idles outside the wrought-iron g of Wayne Manor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try his mag card. FRICK digs in BRUCE's pockets and finds a bunch of RED CAPSULES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.  He's a pillhead. Now FRICK finds a mag-striped card and INSERTS IT into an electronic device at the edge of the drive.  The gates magically part.  There's a large VAN just behind the car driven by FRACK, and carrying two random GOONS.  Both veh pull in before the gates slide shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI hears a signal from the security panel in the kitch announcing what should be BRUCE's arrival.  She heaves a sigh of relief -- then rushes to the door and flings it o She sees BRUCE standing there and her face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh.  Am I glad to -- To her horror, BRUCE topples forward -- and lands on the floor, flat as a board.  VICKI SHRIEKS as the PENGUIN ent throwing his arms wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK has shimmied down to a lower branch.  He lets go and drops to the snow, WINCING; his shoulder wound is bleedin again.  As he grabs his bundle, he hears RAUCOUS LAUGHTER coming from around the house. He races over to peer around the corner.  He sees the two out front.  He sees the last of the goon squad barging in through the front door. His face full of confusion and conflict, he moves to a wi In the entry hall he sees BRUCE on the floor -- and VICKI surrounded by gun-toting intruders.  One of them grabs he twists her arm behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI shrieking and struggling as she stares down at BRUC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?? SELINA gives her a catty little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First-time jitters, I guess.  Everything was going great, and then...he just went limp as a noodle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawn by the commotion, ALFRED rushes down the stairs to entry hall, pulling a robe around him.  He freezes in his tracks when he sees FRICK dragging VICKI into the front parlor, holding a gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be the butler.  Why don't you come on down and attend to your guests? ALFRED hesitates, until the PENGUIN pulls a gun on him. marches down the stairs slowly, pausing by BRUCE's prostr form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wayne.  Is he -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how it is.  Some guys just can't hold their egg nog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN marches ALFRED in where the rest of the gang' already assembled.  FRICK throws VICKI down roughly on a just next to the Christmas tree while the GOONS drag BRUC inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should explain the occasion of our visit.  There's a treasure underneath this house -- and I don't plan to leave until you tell me how to find it.  Now who's going to talk -- Miss Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave.  Under the house.  How do I get there? The PENGUIN gestures.  FRICK holds the gun to her head. VICKI (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  I swear, I would tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to ALFRED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe you'd like to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no more than a common thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, you old idiot. I happen to be a very uncommon thief. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell me, or does Miss Vale get an early present this year? FRICK cocks the gun.  VICKI stares aghast at ALFRED, who the room, weighing his options.  Trembling, he shuts his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...don't...know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go ahead, Mr. Frick...decorate the tree. FRICK's finger tightens on the trigger.  VICKI winces.  A starts to blurt something out.  But a split-second before can speak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! (crossing over to VICKI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know how to get down there yet. We may need her when Bruce wakes up. The PENGUIN sighs and waves FRICK off.  ALFRED and VICKI simultaneous sighs of relief.  He throws her a shamefaced -- but she gives him a tiny nod of acknowledgement: you m the right play. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides -- I want this one for myself.  So pretty...I'm going to give her a brand new face for Christmas. The PENGUIN throws a look at BRUCE, who's still out cold the floor.  He turns to FRICK and FRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two tie up our host? ALFRED sits beside VICKI while SELINA wanders off to tour premises.  FRICK and FRACK, meanwhile, drag BRUCE into a parlor which opens off the room they're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dump BRUCE face down on a sofa -- then rip the telep cords from around the baseboard and use them to bind his and feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still holding his gun on VICKI and ALFRED, he wanders abo the room, admiring the various furnishings and expensive objects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all so plush and tasteful, isn't it? Just the sort of setting in which I've always imagined myself. ALFRED, on the sofa, can't resist letting out a snort of disgust. PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. You think I'm vulgar. You think I'm...nouveau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're a dirty little man with a -- The PENGUIN silences him by sweeping one arm across a tabletop, sending a bunch of PRICELESS CHINA FIGURINES crashing to the floor.  He points to ALFRED as FRICK and reappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, boys, that's old money talking. After a while, they actually start to believe they've earned all this. (smirking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.  Someday I'll be old money too -- when the statute of limitations runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  -- Guess what I just found. Face full of anticipation, he TURNS -- just in time to se SELINA returning from the kitchen with a big silver tray SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas cookies! The PENGUIN is crestfallen, but that doesn't stop him fro cramming a handful of cookies down his gullet.  SELINA graciously serves VICKI and ALFRED, who munch away with limited enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's spread out and see what we can find. (to FRICK and FRACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two -- keep an eye on our friends here.  Give me a yell the minute Wayne comes to. FRICK and FRACK post themselves at the doors to the front parlor as SELINA, the PENGUIN and the GOONS fan out throu the house.  CAMERA TRACKS WITH THEM as they move past BRU -- and in a quick CLOSEUP we see his EYES OPEN -- his han STRUGGLING against his bonds.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: QUICK GLIMPSES of the intruders enacting their depredatio they search for the entrance to the cave.  SELINA and the PENGUIN are flinging open doors, moving clocks, looking f secret panels; as they go, they systematically TEAR THE H APART -- smashing BRUCE's possessions, ripping paintings of frames, etc. Meanwhile, the TWO GOONS are outside prowling around the grounds, looking for an exterior entrance -- and back in parlor, FRICK and FRACK are keeping their guns trained on ALFRED and VICKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS down a long, empty hallway -- arriving at a LOCKED DOOR with curtained-off glass panels.  Suddenly, a ELBOW smashes through the glass -- a hand reaches inside fumbles for the lock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRICK and FRACK start at the sound of a SECURITY ALARM bl from the kitchen.  VICKI looks at ALFRED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better check it out. FRICK stays behind as FRACK rushes out into the entryway down a long hall to the kitchen.  He tosses a glance back VICKI and ALFRED, then steps out into the entryway himsel FRICK (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  What's going on?? VICKI and ALFRED look into the back parlor.  DICK GRAYSON sneaked in behind the sofa -- and he's busy sawing away a BRUCE's bonds with a letter opener.  Both of them stiffen simultaneously -- if FRICK steps back inside, he'll have clear view of DICK and BRUCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRACK has opened a panel on the kitchen wall, revealing t SECURITY SYSTEM from which the alarm emanates.  A RED LIG blinking, indicating DICK's break-in.  FRACK throws switc frantically, trying to kill the sound.  Finally he succee and SHOUTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of security system --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK's gotten BRUCE free -- but BRUCE, still under the ef of the drug, isn't much use.  He tries to get off the sof crumples in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you move, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Library -- got to get me to the library -- DICK slings an arm around BRUCE and drags him to a door opening onto the hallway.  They're just about to step out when FRACK comes marching back on his way from the kitche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- faces wracked with utter, desperate tension as they wa the situation develop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRICK and FRACK conferring, ignoring VICKI and ALFRED for moment.  By now the PENGUIN is waddling in from a hallway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that ungodly racket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security alarm.  It went off in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  Is someone in here? He struts over to huddle with his cronies.  BRUCE and DIC still poised in the doorway.  It looks bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED looks at BRUCE and DICK -- then at FRICK and FRACK bickering with the PENGUIN in the entryway.  He pats VICK knee -- gestures for her to keep her seat -- -- and LUNGES at FRICK, making a play for his gun.  A mom of confusion ensues -- giving DICK and BRUCE just enough to dart out into the hallway, duck around a corner, and vanish -- -- but ALFRED is a frail old gent, and he can't keep it u long; a blow to the face sends him sprawling to the floor FRICK instinctively pulls the trigger and SHOOTS HIM at p blank range. VICKI rushes into the hallway -- screaming, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's a mess, books all over the floor.  The groggy props himself up against his desk.  He manages to pull th bottom drawer open -- gropes frantically for the secret switch.  He's CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...get down there...without you. DICK turns.  To his amazement, the sectional bookcase is swinging open -- revealing the secret passage to the BATC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will all be pleased to know that ALFRED has only suffe superficial wound to the arm.  VICKI is on her knees besi him; the PENGUIN is watching them with utter contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an extraordinarily stupid thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP.  Help me with him. The PENGUIN rolls his eyes and orders FRICK and FRACK to VICKI a hand without him.  They carry him into the parlor him out on the sofa.  VICKI reaches into her purse for a handkerchief and begins binding his wound as the PENGUIN FRACK aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I had better check the ground floor and see what's going on.  Mr. Frick -- do you think you'll be able to manage this pair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.  That does relieve my mind -- He turns, glances into the back parlor, and sees a pile o CORDS on the love seat.  The blood drains out of his face PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Wayne???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK has just entered another world -- and he's looking a him in pure, unalloyed amazement.  BRUCE is fumbling with packet on a spare UTILITY BELT; he shakes out a fistful o pills and swallows them dry. Then he goes to his bank of monitors and begins flipping switches.  They blink on one by one; DICK moves up behind BRUCE and looks on, dazzled.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: The screen shows The PENGUIN in a sun room, shouting to h two armed GOONS through a pair of French doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the grounds!  The shape he's in, he can't have gotten far.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He turns to his main control panel, reaches for a switch, waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two GOONS outside, with guns and flashlights, roaming cautiously around the grounds.  They turn suddenly -- -- as CORRUGATED-STEEL SECURITY PANELS slam into place ov every ground-floor door and window in Wayne Manor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN sees the same thing happening, only from insi He listens helplessly as his GOONS pound on the steel pan from outside.  It's just occurred to him that he's trappe here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK is up on a catwalk leading back to the library of Wa Manor.  BRUCE shouts up to him from the control console d below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as soon as he gets to the East wing. Wait for my signal.  You know what to do. DICK nods yes and bolts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI and ALFRED are still sitting at gunpoint.  With the commotion going on all around them, FRICK is getting itch fingered. Suddenly the STEREO begins blaring at top volwne -- "SANT BRING MY BABY BACK TO ME."  FRICK turns and stares at it confusion -- goes over to fiddle with the controls -- -- and suddenly BRUCE'S VOICE is coming through the loudspeakers. BRUCE (O.S.; filter)

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: She's off the sofa like a shot, DIVING for the entry hall FRICK turns and takes aim -- -- but before he can squeeze the trigger, DICK's come out nowhere to HIGH-KICK him in the face!  The shot goes wild the two of them tumble into the Christmas tree, knocking over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI hits the floor of the entry hall.  HUGE OAKEN SLIDI DOORS are already slamming shut behind her.  The same thi happening all down the hall -- the East wing of the house sealing itself off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DICK CARTWHEELS across the carpet -- catching FRICK high the chest and RAMMING him backward, into the hearth.  Bef FRICK can regain his balance, DICK's BEANED HIM across th back of the skull with a fireplace poker. He bends and picks up FRICK's gun -- which he tosses to ALFRED, who's been watching all this with some fascinatio from the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  You might need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Master Dick.  And...bravo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI has made it to the wall phone.  She can't seem to g dial tone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think we're that stupid? VICKI turns, and realizes to her horror that the VOICE is SELINA's. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tawt I taw a puddy tat...!! With that she raises a hand -- and her CLAWS pop out.  VI turns, grabs a carving knife from a wooden block -- but b she can do anything with it, a WHIP cracks and wraps arou her wrist, jerking the knife loose.  SELINA tugs on the o end, reeling her closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've got a great recipe for Sliced Bitch -- VICKI lunges forward suddenly, causing the whip to slacke throwing SELINA off-balance into the center island.  Whil they're tangled up, VICKI grabs a MEAT CLEAVER and tries bring it down on SELINA, but SELINA rolls effortlessly ou the way and returns the favor, SWIPING at VICKI with her claws.  VICKI brings a Calphalon skillet up just in time block the blow: CLANG. VICKI sweeps her arm across the countertop, showering SEL with knives and appliances.  It buys her enough time to m for the door -- but SELINA comes flying after her.  Anoth downswipe with the claws -- but VICKI shoves a BUTCHER'S into SELINA's path, and her TALONS wedge a half-inch deep the wood. VICKI rushes out while she's trying to pry herself loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA enters but finds no trace of VICKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love a good old-fashioned catfight -- but this is pissing me off. VICKI charges out from behind a sideboard, pushing a WHEE COCKTAIL CART before her.  It SLAMS full-force into SELIN who lands on her back on the great long dining table.  VI is in the doorway to the entry hall by the time she gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI races up the stairs.  She has a good lead, but SELI makes up the difference in a hurry.  She takes the stairw three giant bounds -- reaches the landing just as VICKI d down the hall and into a bedroom, slamming the door behin and LOCKING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERE, kitty kitty kitty...HERE, kitty kitty... She KICKS THE DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA enters and strikes a coy pose as she shuts the doo behind her.  VICKI has opened a pair of French doors lead to a balcony, but it's too long a drop.  She stands there paralyzed as SELINA advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is where you earn your keep. She GRABS VICKI -- holds her out at arm's length and shov her roughly back onto the bed.  VICKI flails wildly as SE kneels atop her... SELINA's CLAWS shred VICKI's blouse, revealing a frilly section of bra --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm!  Frederick's of Gotham? She plants a talon against VICKI's sternum and RAKES IT DOWNWARD, drawing a RED STRIPE on the exposed flesh of VI belly.  Now VICKI just loses it.  She begins to SHRIEK uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so loud, honey! The neighbors'll get the wrong idea. (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa's coming.  Time for all good girls to go to sleep... She raises her claw-hand and prepares to slash down at VI neck.  But an instant before she can strike -- VICKI goes wide-eyed and shuts up.  A BLACK SHADOW falls across the moonlit bed.  SELINA tenses -- -- as a BLACK-GLOVED HAND grabs a fistful of her hair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss me, "Angel"? He yanks her bodily off the bed.  Before she knows what's happening, he delivers a POWERHOUSE UPPERCUT.  She flies the door and knocks it cleanly off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN steps out after SELINA, who's only now picking her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- let's do it, huh?  You and me... all the way this time. She HISSES and jumps him.  They grapple -- a quick flurry fists -- and he knocks her ass-over-teakettle down the lo stairway. She gets to her feet, limping, and darts around a corner. BATMAN marches implacably down the stairs, taking his tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKI rushes out of the bedroom.  She looks down the hall sees FRACK flying out of the guest room, UPSIDE DOWN -- slamming into the wall opposite.  He slumps to the carpet cold. A moment later DICK strolls out.  VICKI rushes to his sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  We'll be safe in the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATMAN PAUSES outside the door to the armory, which is slightly ajar.  He pushes it in cautiously... ...and a HALBERD smashes through the wood frame -- slicin down mere inches from his face.  It's the PENGUIN wieldin ax; he backs off in seeming terror as BATMAN advances on But then -- -- SELINA springs down from a perch above the doors -- la on his back -- and the two of them are going at it again. It's a room full of exotic weaponry, and most of it gets good workout in the next thirty seconds. BATMAN dodges a LANCE -- which embeds itself into the wal behind him, QUIVERING -- and swings a MACE squarely into SELINA's ribs.  It's a crippling blow; she flies backward knocking over a suit of exotic armor -- which TOPPLES, knocking over another -- and another -- -- until the various suits of armor have all fallen over, domino-style -- the last of them landing squarely atop th cowering PENGUIN. SELINA is badly hurt now.  She makes it out of a rear doo the armory.  BATMAN pauses to check on the PENGUIN -- he to be out for the count -- and sets off in pursuit of SEL SEVERAL MOMENTS PASS before the groaning PENGUIN comes ar enough to dig himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the PENGUIN stumbles around a corner, he peers into th LIBRARY.  VICKI is crouched by BRUCE's desk, reaching int bottom drawer.  A hidden panel in the bookcase pops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she helps ALFRED into the secret passageway, VICKI tur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I can still help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN flattens against the wall as DICK sprints out the library and heads off in the opposite direction.  The a flabbergasted look on his face -- he recognizes this ki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the monitor bank, watching BATMAN's pursuit of SELINA, VICKI and ALFRED.  They pivot suddenly at the sound of a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such primitive entertainment. He's holding a gun on the two of them.  He stares about delightedly, taking in the prehistoric splendor of the ca His eyes light up at the sight of the BATMOBILE, parked o little plateau. PENGUIN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Bruce equals Batman. It seems I've discovered two treasures! (an evil smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.  I'd be only too happy to shoot you both. He pulls out his packet of photos and begins to scan the He spots the distinctive ROCK FORMATION in an upper vault the cavern.  It's a couple of plateaus over; a long narro CATWALK runs past it, some ten or twelve feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gotham City Treasury.  It's about to be stolen twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be absurd. You'll never be able to get it out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll manage somehow. You two are my guarantee of that. (nudging VICKI with the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a look, shall we?  You go first. He shoves her.  She starts across the catwalk, his gun at head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELINA's made it back upstairs, but she's moving at quart speed, favoring one leg and clutching her ribs as she lop down the hallway.  She's just passed the balcony overlook the entry hall when BATMAN appears dead ahead in her path He's ready to rumble -- but instead of responding, she pa it in.  She stops, slumps against a wall and begins to la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could've been so nice -- you and me -- if only you weren't so screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.  I don't want to hurt you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something -- one thing.  If you don't enjoy all this...why do you do it? He just looks at her.  He doesn't have an especially good answer.  She sighs. SELINA (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never understand men. She SPINS SUDDENLY, delivering a high-kick to BATMAN's th As he reels backward, into a wall, she leaps up onto the narrow BANNISTER RAILING some thirty feet above the entry floor and goes into a CROUCH -- preparing to SPRING at th enormous crystal CHANDELIER mounted to the ceiling -- -- but just as she launches off, BATMAN rolls -- and brin a GUN from his belt.  He fires a RAZOR-SHARP DISK which s past her head, cleanly SLICING THROUGH the chain which suspends the chandelier. The chandelier FALLS just as CATWOMAN catches hold of it and she finds herself PLUMMETING to the floor of the entr hall.  On impact, the chandelier EXPLODES into a thousand fragments; the CATWOMAN lands hard on her back and lies sprawled in the midst of the wreckage, unmoving. BATMAN advances slowly down the stairs.  Her arms and leg out at unnatural angles; she lets out an eerie, whimperin YOWL OF PAIN -- a cri du chat.  He stands over her; she g up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't move.  I can't move. Her face is cut and bleeding.  She tries to lift an arm a can't quite manage it.  He crouches down beside her, stil cautious... CATWOMAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: DON'T LOOK AT ME
dialogues.text: (pleading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me, baby...do me now...that's what I want.  Please? BATMAN looks up.  DICK is standing on the balcony overloo them, highly curious as to what he'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BATMAN slowly rises to his feet.  She lets out another gruesome WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME ON. Don't stop now. FINISH ME OFF. (almost weeping with pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.  You're all alike... Her STEEL CLAWS snick into place.  With an agonizing effo she lifts her forearm -- bends her wrist.  She's trying t slit her own throat. He reaches for his belt, extracts a GLASSINE CAPSULE, and breaks it open with his thumb.  He drops it amid the shat glass around her face.  A tiny cloud of GREEN GAS plumes and her hand falls limply at her side as she lapses into unconsciousness. BATMAN stands over her for a minute as DICK marches down join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've done it, man.  You should've killed her. BATMAN gives him a long, hard look -- but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a radio in the cave.  We'll send for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PENGUIN and VICKI are on a catwalk just below the ROC FORMATION.  A STONE OUTCROPPING extends toward the catwal and he forces her to JUMP FOR IT.  Now he has to follow; prospect makes him nervous, but it's a short hop, and he clears it okay -- finding his footing on the rocky slope. They're cautiously making their way up toward the ROCK FORMATION when BATMAN appears suddenly at the far end of catwalk -- sizes up the situation and FREEZES IN HIS TRAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the illustrious Mr. Wayne. Look at you now. Whatever would your friends say? (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been an exceptionally congenial host -- but I must ask you to back off. The PENGUIN grabs hold of VICKI and HOLDS HER CLOSE as th climb the last few feet toward the grotto.  BATMAN swings cape around, concealing his hands from view.  He takes a cautious step backward.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN'S HAND
dialogues.text: His free hand closes around a BATARANG -- flicks it open.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKS
dialogues.text: They've pulled almost even with the rock formation.  A LA DANK GROTTO is visible through a small gap in the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sudden moves.  It's a long way down. Gun at her head, he peers into the grotto...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GROTTO
dialogues.text: A VAST FORTUNE in GOLD and SILVER BULLION, undisturbed in these years.  GLINTING in the darkness.  Hanging upside-d above it, like silent guardians, are BATS -- DOZENS of th their tiny wet red eyes GLIMMERING at the PENGUIN... He dislodges a rock.  It tumbles into the grotto... ...and a startled BAT comes screeching out of the gap in rocks -- FLYING DIRECTLY AT HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKS
dialogues.text: He BACKS AWAY IN HORROR as the bat streaks past him.  He HIS GUN wildly.  The SOUND OF IT rouses MORE BATS, and th come flying out of the hole -- a VAST, CHITTERING SWARM. VICKI SHRIEKS; the PENGUIN STUMBLES -- and the two of the FALL BACK ONTO THE ROCKS, hanging on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: VICKI
dialogues.text: An instant later BATMAN lets fly with the BATARANG.  Clea hit; the PENGUIN staggers back, and his GUN skitters down across the rocks. With BATS screaming all around her, VICKI takes a deep br and VAULTS toward the CATWALK.  She's a foot short; she g hold of the railing and HANGS THERE, over the ABYSS, tryi pull herself up.  BATMAN races toward her -- -- but the PENGUIN, clambering down across the rocky outcropping, has managed to grab hold of his GUN.  The BA have begun to swirl up toward the higher recesses of the cavern, and he's able to draw a clean bead on BATMAN. THUNDEROUS ECHOES reverberate through the cave as the fir shot strikes BATMAN and knocks him backward.  As the seco spins him around.  As the third sends him TOPPLING OVER T RAILING. VICKI screams.  BATMAN manages to grab the rail with one Now two of them are hanging from the catwalk -- sitting d -- and the PENGUIN is determined to empty the clip. The ECHOES are cacophanous.  ANCIENT STALACTITES drop fro vaulted roof of the cavern, PLUMMETING DOWNWARD like dead projectiles, shattering agaist the cave floor.  And then BATMAN pulls a tiny DEVICE from his utility belt and FLIN IT.  It lands in the rocks at the PENGUIN's feet.  He sta down at it, and two beats later -- -- it begins to emit an EERIE ELECTRONIC WHINE.  Within moments, EVERY BAT IN THE CAVE is in a FRENZY -- HOMING I THE SIGNAL.  The PENGUIN looks up sees them coming.  A CH WAIL emits from his throat as he drops the gun and stands there, PARALYZED. He's just been beaten at his own game.  He lets out a las awful HOWL as HUNDREDS OF BATS ENGULF HIM -- -- and he PLUNGES DOWN INTO THE PIT -- his hideous scream dwindling to a faint echo, then vanishing altogether... BATMAN manages to drag himself up onto the catwalk.  He r over to VICKI, pulls her up, drapes his cape around her protectively.  Gradually, as the BATS recede to their dis perches, he stands and helps VICKI to her feet.  They emb on the edge of the abyss. On the far plateau, DICK has hooked up with ALFRED.  The butler is slumped against a lab table, weary and exhauste clutching his wounded arm.  DICK slings an arm around him helps him to the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUAD CARS everywhere.  FRICK and FRACK emerge in handcuf flanked by COPS.  PARAMEDICS carry the still-unconscious SELINA past on a stretcher and load her into the back of ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is an utter mess.  Amid the carnage we find BRU conferring with COMMISSIONER GORDON and LT. BULLOCK.  In a POLICE DOCTOR is dressing ALFRED's gunshot wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then Batman showed up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saved all our lives, Jim.  I can't say for sure, but I'd bet she's the one behind the murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God -- I pray you're right. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing before we go, Bruce.  Who's the kid? BRUCE looks into the front parlor, where VICKI and DICK a righting the fallen Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's Vicki's little cousin.  He's in town for the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he picked a hell of a time to visit. (turning to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Bruce.  Good luck cleaning this place up. GORDON and BULLOCK file out, followed by the POLICE DOCTO BRUCE smiles wearily to himself and strolls into the fron parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED loads 'SILENT NIGHT' on the CD.  VICKI ambles up t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with all that gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  Might be a good start on a place to live -- for some people who don't have one. She hugs him.  DICK plugs in the Christmas-tree lights; t blink to life just as the GRANDFATHER CLOCK strikes twelv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Maybe you should -- open your present. She runs a hand along his cheek and laughs softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Bruce, presents doesn't matter.  None of it matters.  We're all safe.  We're together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You might as well. He digs around in his jacket pocket and produces a tiny G BOX, which he hands to VICKI.  She unwraps it, opens it s -- and sees a DIAMOND RING inside. She gazes up at him, speechless.  He gazes back. CAMERA PULLS UP and away until we can see the whole of th devastated room, and all the people in it -- VICKI, falli into BRUCE's arms; DICK, off to one side, watching them; ALFRED, tossing broken furniture into a roaring fireplace And on the image of this decidedly eccentric family unit,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: </is></vigilantes>
